Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Madrid and this hotel which is in the centre of the 'old town' everything is within walking distance, fabulous shops, stunning architecture, a must see for all.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, well located, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: vbcats
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what we were looking for. Centrally located. Safe. Clean and comfortable. Located right next door to the Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales. Right across the street from the Chagall exhibit. We stayed in a 16th century palace. We, also, had an interior room looking into the courtyard below, but it had a great air conditioning system and was very comfortable. The bathroom is small but very well designed and really functional. I am a cosmetics junkie and I had plenty of room for everything with a little left over for my husband. The shower was great and we had a very comfortable bed. The bar outside was really fun and Barbara is the best waitress. Let me put it this way, our friends wanted to stay at the Ritz at three times the price and they were very happy that I talked them into the Palacio.

Reviews.Title: “Very central in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Jannik J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Intur Palacio San Martin is e very convenient hotel in the centrum of Madrid if you wish to visit the art museums and the royal castle, Puerto de Sol and Placa Mayor on foot. We had a room with a view to the inner courtyard as we asked for a quiet room. That turned out to be a little too stuffy getting no fresh air when we opened the windows – but it was our mistake – the next time I will ask for a room facing the cloister on the small palace in front of the hotel. The hotel itself is in a very old building – we had a good room that needed a little more lights in my opinion, a quiet and efficient elevator and very good firm beds. Bathroom was also to our satisfaction and the staff very efficient. Breakfast good with a lot of choices and the little bar has a very good red wine by the glass. We brought the Michelin guide for restaurants but that was not necessary as there are many good places just around the corner – a tapas and wine place with very good inexpensive food and wine in the nearby street. We paid 35 euros for the taxa from Barajas airport – not bad and will look forward to go back to Palacio San Martin. The first taxi driver took us to hotel Charmartin – and was rather rude when we explained the difference – so remember the phrase Intur when naming the hotel. The Chagall exhibit free of charge opposite the hotel is worth visiting but do so in the morning as there are long lines in the afternoon. We missed the cloister – if you want to go make an arrangement at the cloister in the morning and return at the arranged time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: alicia_caldas
Reviews.Content: right in the heart of the city but in a quiet plaza. The rooms are very good and it's not expensive. We didn´t have breakfast at the hotel, though, so I don't know if the food's good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Conor K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012. Very central. Within walking distance of the Royal Palace. Taxis are very reasonable in Madrid and we took them to the Prado and the Modern Museums. The convent next door was well worth a visit as was the Chagall exhibition across the road. The hotel staff were very helpful with all queries including directions to the nearest post office in the oddest of locations... the underground car park of the nearby department store. The bathroom was very well equipped... combs, razor blades and tissues as well as the usual shampoos and lotions. Despite its central location, and despite other comments, the room we requested was very quiet at night. Sitting outside in the evening with a glass of wine was very relaxing...friendly service and reasonable prices. Cons: The sauna was fine but no toilet and no shower in the sauna and gym room was a disadvantage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MA_Fuchs
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels I have stayed in, in any city. The location couldn't be better. It is an easy walk to shopping on Gran Via, Sol, Plaza Mayor, and the Royal Palace. Upon arrival, we bought a ten ride metro pass at the airport and that was the last time we used it. We spent 6 days in the city and even went to the museum area and Park Retiro twice and never used the metro. The hotel itself is located a block off a main drag, so even with this location, it is quietly tucked away on a little square with minimal traffic. There are church bells as others have talked about, it woke me up a few of the nights but did not bother my wife. Having a patio looking over the square and the monastery was well worth this slight inconvenience. Rooms were large and very nice. Staff was very friendly when we talked with them. We spoke very little Spanish and had no problem. We thought they might get tired of us since we kept bringing back bottles of wine to have the bar open but they were very kind and ensured we even had nice clean glasses of wine in our room each night. Other negatives I have read talk about lack of or high expense of breakfast/dinner. I don't quite get this complaint as within 2 minutes walk in any direction there are so many places to eat a wide variety of foods. We had breakfast and dinner right around the corner on many occassions. If we visit again, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good value.”
Reviews.Author: aidan o
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel in August 2010. Great location near stores, bars, restaurants and essential Madrid sights(the Poor Clares convent is next door, a "Top 10 "guide recommendation). The hotel is clean with spacious rooms and good bathrooms. I liked the reading room downstairs, nice place to relax after a hard day sight seeing. The old fashioned lift is a quirky touch. Couldn't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: CornishTraveller11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quiet square not far from Puerto del Sol and easily accessible from three nearby metro stations. The hotel is lovely, quiet rooms overlook a spectacular indoor courtyard. Staff are very pleasant and polite and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Many sights are within easy walking distance making the hotel a great spot for sightseeing and the sightseeing hop on hop off bus can be picked up in Sol square for a bigger view of Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location but a Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frederick p
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the hotel following favourable reviews from fellow tripadvisor reviewers to celebrate a 60th birthday with my twin brother. Like a recent reviewer the hotel staff were made aware of this at the time of booking and we requested rooms on the same floor. Upon arrival at the hotel we checked into our room to find the shower door literally leaning against the outer wall and the wardrobe door hanging off it's runners . I brought this immediately to the receptionist staff attention only to be told the hotel was full and they would move us the next day. The absence of surprise at the defects and the lack of any sort of apology was notable. The room itself was clean and a credit to the staff responsible but, having said that,verging on the shabby with very worn carpets. We had to wait until after 2pm the next day to check into a new room and even then,the keys to the new room were tossed to us with no hint of an apology. This is a real pity as a beautiful building in a wonderful location is being allowed to go to seed with clearly a customer service issue with some of the reception staff a real issue. The hotel could be a real gem. This was our fourth visit to Madrid and we do travel extensively. We did enjoy our visit in spite of the shortcomings mentioned. We would have enjoyed it a lot more with a bit more attention to detail to make our special occasion more pleasant and a bit of money spent on the place. The owners should take note. This is a real pity T

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: c g
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2011 for sisters 50th birthday, which despite mentioning when booking and having balloons/cards etc in room was not picked up at all by staff - a Happy Birthday at breakfast or card left in room from management would have been nice. Excellent location. Rooms dark and dreary. Buffet breakfast which was comprehensive and delicious. You could order hot items but there was a huge array of fresh fruit, meats cheeses, breads and cakes. Overall we were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly quiet hotel in central location. Lacks good breakfast and supper”
Reviews.Author: rorymac9
Reviews.Content: First time in Madrid. Rooms quiet and clean. Very friiendly service. Quite a way to walk to Prado but close to Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor. Strong wifi signal which is fast most of the time. Can't fault the rooms. But the breakfast at 10E is overpriced. Toaster didn't work. No porridge or hot buffet food.. You have to ask for it. No evening restaurant but there iLll'.l.s a good Meson on the side next to the convent de Las Descalzas. You can get breakfast around so I would skip breakfast next time. But will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Madrid Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aweighandappy
Reviews.Content: Saturday 11th February 2012 until Saturday 18th February 2012 From our arrival to our departure I could not find any negative points about the hotel or the hotel staff, quite the contrary in fact. At the entrance we were greeted and a member of staff took charge of our luggage. The receptionist was pleasant and explained the basics in English as our Spanish is to say the least below requirements. The lobby is narrow, but fit for purpose and opens out into a spacious lounge area which has a multi-panelled clear glass ceiling looking up to a clear glass roof over the lounge, the four walls which face into the area are the rooms away from the streets. There are two lifts, one modern and one which is beautifully restored from an era of elegance long gone. Our room overlooked the Plaza San Martin and we had a lovely view over the opposite roof tops. The rooms are comfortable and the beds whilst giving the appearance of being double are in fact two wide singles pushed together. Excellent nights sleep was had in what we both agreed are one of the most comfortable of hotel beds. The room was of adequate size complete with mini-bar and free room safe along with the usual trimmings. The dining room which is on the ground floor appears to have recently been decorated in what we thought are tasteful elements. Breakfast consists of an extensive buffet array which surely caters for every taste, and there is an option to have additional items cooked upon request. The dining room doubles as the restaurant in the evening and is open until midnight. The menu is of traditional Spanish cuisine and whilst good, we thought a bit over priced. Attractions in the locality, opposite are the museum where there is presently an art collection by the Russian artist Marc Chagall. The Real Palace is within a 15 minute walk, Opera is nearer and en-route to the Royal Palace. The Plaza Sol where most of Madrid seems to congregate on Sunday afternoon is less then 10 min walk. The local transport network is fantastic and we would recommend the purchase of the Tourist Ticket as it is exceptional value for money being available on the Metro and the EMT bus networks. Nearest Metro station is about 400m from the hotel at Callao and if leaving the Metro choose the exit that brings you out onto Plaza Callao and head for Calle San Martin (a pedestrian only street) We will return as Madrid has a lot more to offer than can be catered for in one week.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of value”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a week stay in Spain. Loved the location of this hotel and I believe it was a great value. It is located in a quiet square only a few short blocks of Puerta de Sol and close to many attractions and restaurants. Rooms were clean and we had a cute balcony overlooking the square. Had no trouble with noise with at all. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Very comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FM_arg
Reviews.Content: Pros: central location, nice comfortable rooms, free wifi with strong signal (they installed more than a dozen of routers). Only con: I visited during the hardest part of winter so the streets outside were relatively calm, but you can tell that people tend to gather in the plaza right outside the hotel (beggars and young people that sit on the street for a drink). Of course that's not the hotel's fault, but it can get to bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and a great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NicoWawa
Reviews.Content: I went in this hotel for a couple of days during summer. The location is perfect. It is just nearby Plaza Mayor and other sightseeing in Madrid such as the Opera, the Royal Castle. The building, which is antique, is beautiful as well in the inside as the outside. FYI, there is a charming old elevator! I asked for a room at the highest floor possible with a view on the Plaza San Martin and I had it. The room was spacious and the view breathtaking. Breakfast was excellent. The breakfast room is at the top floor and has a beautiful view as well. The only thing was that the receptionist was a bit rude... Except of that, our stay was great. I warmly advise you to go at this hotel. It is a great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located hotel in the very heart of Madrid old city...”
Reviews.Author: Mehmetbugra
Reviews.Content: Nice medium size hotel. Very near to the Callao metro station and Puerta del Sol. We stayed at one of the junior suites. It was not large but adequate, clean and comfortable. From the airport : you can use shuttle buses to reach Fuente de Cibeles ( 2 euros) and then walk 30 meters to the metro station of Banco de Espana. (Buy tourist pass ticket for 1 to 7 days, it would be the best choice to reacheverywhere in madrid) and then take line2 (red) to Puerta del Sol station. Walkto the north (calle de preciados) turn left in 100 meters. If you need ask someone plaza san martin:) Room tip: Choose front side room and if possible a junior suite ;)

Reviews.Title: “A week of bliss in a great hotel in the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Saltywords
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Intur Palacio San Martin and what a joy it was! The hotel is located within a walking distance from many of the Madrid attractions: Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales is virtually next door, the Royal Opera & Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor are less than 10 minutes away, as is Puerta del Sol. Il Corte Ingles - a store with everything - is a few hundred metres down the road. In fact we walked everywhere: Prado, Thyseen-Bornemisza, Park Retiro, even Museo Reina Sofia which is a bit further away... There is a good selection of eateries, coffee shops and restaurants near the hotel. Don't miss Chocolateria San Gines for its amazing hot chocolate and churos - it is two minutes away from the hotel. As the hotel is so centrally located there is no shortage of good shops, whether you are looking for boutiques, Spanish souvenirs, or quirky items. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Our room was fairly spacious, with a great bathroom. It was very clean and the room maids did an excellent job of maintaining it fresh and welcoming. The room was overlooking the lobby and was incredibly quiet, in fact, we had some of the best night sleep anywhere in the world! A tip: some taxi drivers seem to find it a bit difficult to find the hotel - just ask them to take you to Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales, one of Madrid's visitor attractions. The hotel door is 20 metres from it. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We'll sure be back next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation location”
Reviews.Author: DSTgar
Reviews.Content: Beautifully situated on a quiet plaza (a bit hard to get to, actually), you're just minutes (any direction) from a great Madrid experience. Room comfort and amenities were very good, and a good value (booked through hotels.com). Don't miss touring the convent next door, buying tickets FIRST THING IN THE MORNING when they open the tiny door. The weather was great when we were there (late Sept), so we didn't spend much time in the room or the lobby, preferring to join los Madrileños in their incessant paseo. True, this hotel is not so close to the museum district, but I'd rather be in a livelier neighborhood anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The place for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dick74
Reviews.Content: It is the second time in three years we have stayed here and everything is fine - from the gin and tonics to breakfasts to location to the rooms and to the staff. 300m to Plaza Meyor, 400m to Mercado San Miguel, 150m to one of the largest Cortes El Ingles and 50m to a superb Asturian restaurant round the side. Don't really want to praise them too much in case too many of you go there!

Reviews.Title: “Professionally run; great location”
Reviews.Author: Naomi_X0
Reviews.Content: Professionally run, clean, nice ammenities, comfortable sitting areas in lobby, fantastic location - very easy walk to areas of interest including Metro. Consider where you want your room -- we loved our balcony overlooking the square, but the noise of the scraping metal chairs or of late nighters talking/walking across, were sounds that woke us up. A good business trip option because of the professionalism and sitting areas. An excellent tourist option because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just right :o)”
Reviews.Author: rap100r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way back from the Canaries. We visit Madrid quite often, and we have stayed at many hotels there. We thought this particular hotel was very nice. The staff were polite and helpful, the breakfast was lovely, and there was a really cosy seated area in the lobby. We met up with our friends there and had coffee, and sometimes a night cap, it was very pleasant. Our rooms were clean and warm, and it was quiet too. Its in the very heart of Madrid, but not a noisy area, we were just 2 minutes from the main shopping area. We will definately be staying at this hotel in the future, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny197109
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a perfect location. Strongly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShanMara
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on others' reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is great - within easy walking distance to several plazas, metro, the Palace, shopping, and restaurants. I had asked in our reservation for a quiet room and they accommodated us. Our room (#315) was spacious, clean, had great wi-fi, and was certainly quiet. The bathroom was very nice. We did not use the breakfast room, but walked to a nearby Starbucks. The front desk staff was extremely professional and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but big shortcomings with food....”
Reviews.Author: Sam J
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice and spacious, but the bidet is uncomfortably close to the toilet with no space at all! The staff are friendly. Room service was NOT good....ordered a tuna pizza with olives and red peppers and got just a pizza with tuna. When I called to complain they said they had run out of olives and red pepper...it would have been good if they had told me this when I ordered, or at least called me when they realised instead of trying to fob me off with something I didn't order!! The night before when I ordered a salad with pesto dressing, there was no pesto dressing, just an olive oil and balsamic dressing!! Not the type of service I would expect from a 4* hotel, and irritating when you expect to get what you order. Hotel Intur you need to sort out your attention to detail!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, Calleo, Opera and Puerta Del Sol metro stations within easy access. Calleo probably best from the Airport and is only 100m from hotel - it's just straight down the hill off the Gran Via. Booked a Junior Suite on 5th floor and glad we did, very spacious and we enjoyed the extra room. Room was very, very clean although soundproofing was not so good. We popped back to room in the late morning and workman outside the room replacing wallpaper in the corridor, so effort made whilst you are out and about !! Was nice to hear the bells from the Convent right next door ring out - gave a romantic feel. Staff were polite enough and friendly. Breakfast was average and could have choice of hot or cold - service was good. It has just recently moved from the 6th floor to the ground floor (pictures show restaurant on 6th) - not sure they have got to grips with the move just yet and might struggle if the hotel was fully booked. Overall it was an excellent stay in a great hotel in an absolutely fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish / Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bluebell09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very pleasurable experience at the Intur Palacio San Martin. Checking in was simple and fast, very professional. Room wise – well-appointed and spacious, balcony overlooked a side street and small market area, lovely and bright as requested. Bathroom well equipped, excellent shower and decent hairdryer! The only fault was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. The staff were very helpful and always polite but not over the top. Location wise, for us this was perfect, central and fairly quiet with everything within walking distance, including metro stations, shops/cafes and all major sights – couldn’t fault it! I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: ioannistourountous
Reviews.Content: Very good location in the center of the city. Three metro station near the hotel. Plaza del sol plaza mayor, the restaurants of la latina, the opera in a walking distance. Spacious room. Old decoration but not bad. Sound-proofing not good. Cleanliness very good. Breakfast good. Most of the stuff helpfull and friendly. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Vlodi
Reviews.Content: Together with my wife we stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Elegant, classical building of former US Embassy. We had a spacy room at 4th fl. overlooking the neighbouring church. The location is perfect for tourists: between Plaza Mayor, Gran Via and the Royal castle and surrounded by multiple shops of El Corte Ingles. Close to hop-on hop-off bus stops. Air condition and free wi-fi added to the comfort of beds and bathroom. Very good, friendly service. Very positive impression of breakfast (but there are also a lot of opportunities to have a nice breakfast in the area). Nothing to complain, really; can recommend this hotel for a pleasent city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Didn't Love Location”
Reviews.Author: ntjvy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, rooms comfortable, staff helpful, however I didn't love the location. It's certainly in the midst of Madrid, walking distance to a lot of things, but it was on the wrong side of the Puerto de Sol for my taste which for me was like the Times Square of Spain. Prefer something close to The Prado etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent BUT”
Reviews.Author: sidneyxx
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and since returning home I have read the latest reviews. I would agree with most things - we enjoyed our stay, would return there again, and would recommend it to our friends. Staff were exceptional, as was location, and great having free internet in roonm. Also, having El Cortes Ingles Department Store/Supermarket/Travel Agency (they do everything), right nearby was a plus. BUT I would nit-pick about a few things. We stayed on 3 occasions over 2 weeks, and had 3 different rooms. Firstly it was room 504 - we were upgraded to a suite and were over the moon. Couldn't fault anything - except no tea making facilities. We solved this by buying an electric jug at aforementioned store, plus two mugs. We used them extensively on our trip. Next we stayed in room 402. This was a double room and quite good, but we had been spoilt by our suite, so for our final visit we paid for an upgrade. Room 402 and the suite we had had excellent bathrooms. Back again to Room 508, our suite we upgrade to. What a disappointment. It was facing the afternoon sun and was boiling hot even with the air-conditioner. On the outside balcony there was an ashtray full of cigarette butts, and these remained there for 4 days! It didn't seem as big as our previous suite, but the bathroom was just awful. Not even as big as our ordinary room, the toilet and bidet almost touched each other and you couldn't sit on toilet in the normal manner. But worst of all it had an ultra modern shower (no doubt cost a fortune), but we couldn't even get it to work on the simplest setting. Staff, as usual, were most obliging and went out of their way to help us, but even they struggled to get it to work in the simplest way possible. So disappointing our stay in this room. Note the numbers I quoted and you will find a great room at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hilary E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for 2 nights on a city break. The hotel is very characterful with a beautiful original lift ( plus a modern one!) our room overlooked the front and had a balcony. The room was spacious and well equipped. Without doubt the best feature of this hotel was its position pretty much in the middle of the the most famous squares, Plaza Mayor and Puerto de Sol only a few minutes walk from them both. The breakfast was good with ample choice and the staff were helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: Coellum
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in a room facing the Descalzas. It was spacious enough for three people and even had a sofa and coffee table. There was no coffee maker which would have added some convenience. The closet was small. The bathroom was big with a bath tub and bidet. Surprisingly, the ringing of the Descalzas bells didn't really bother us. We could not have asked for a better location. The hotel is well located for sightseeing, shopping and dining. El Corte Ingles is just down the street. We had churros and chocolate at Valor which was behind the hotel. One night, we had dinner at Asador de Aranda on the street behind the hotel, Calle Preciados. We walked to Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and Palacio Real. We used the metro to go to the Prado and Thyssen museums but I think we could have walked it. The breakfast buffet was generous. I had cava every time we ate there. There were poached pears. Delicious! You could ask for freshly cooked omelets or scrambled eggs. The personnel were not overly friendly but were helpful enough. They made our reservation at El Botin. They booked our tour to Toledo. Maybe it is the language barrier. Anyway, they were alright. I would stay at San Martin again if I return to Madrid. It is centrally located but on a quiet street. Most ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug0208
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. Close to shopping centre, train, Plaza Mayor, palace, we walked everywhere. Although it is quite a long walk to Retiro Park. When we first arrived our airconditioning did not work, so we reported it to reception. A gentleman came to our room to check we had the settings right, he left and shortly phoned to inform us that the room would be cold in 15 minutes as they had to connect it to something (?). Anyway, we left for the afternoon and returned to a hot room, so they relocated us to another room which was on the top floor and had great views. Just not sure why we weren't moved in the beginning. We didn't have any tour options or sightseeing info provided to us from reception at all. We'd already organised what we wanted to do before our holiday so this didn't bother us. We only received an 'Hola' every morning when we walked past. The free wi-fi is great and connection is good. If you're someone that doesn't like to wear wrinkled clothing, be sure to bring a travel iron as there is not one provided in the room, and it costs 4-14 Euros to iron an article of clothing through the laundry service, depending on what it is. The bed is two singles pushed together, and made up as singles too (each bed has its own sheets). The beds are simply pushed together with a king size coverlet over it. Very comfy though, and so are the pillows we had. Only two english speaking tv channels - BBC and Europe BBC. Cant comment on the restaurant as we didnt eat there. There are literally hundreds of restaurants around, including restaurants in the alley up the side. The first one you come across from the hotel end (Descales - spelling?) - do not eat there. Horrible food, rude service, and 4 Euro for a small basket of bread!! They brought the bill to us, we pulled out the exact amount of money only for the man to say "tips are not included in this total" (very odd as everywhere else includes a service charge). So he left it on the table and waited for us to leave a tip. Very bad, and lucky we didn't come across this anywhere else in Madrid otherwise we would've hated our trip. We did a trip out to Avila and Segovia for a day which was nice to get out of the city as there isn't that much to do in Madrid. Next time we visit we'll most likely stay out in the country, out of the city, and visit when it is snowing so we can go skiing on the mountains. We do recommend Intur Palacio San Martin purely for its convenient location and would stay here again if we visted the city next time :)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityEKT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six-night stay at the Palacio San Martin (an Intur hotel) and can’t recommend it enough. It is reasonably priced and centrally located. We walked everywhere from the hotel—from the Royal Palace to the Prado to Salamanca and everywhere in between. The hotel, two blocks from Plaza Mayor, is quiet and charming. It has beautiful parquet wood floors and an antique elevator that is glass-enclosed. The room was spacious and clean, with modern amenities; the bathroom, which had the strongest blow dryer we’ve ever used (not just in a hotel—ever) was much larger than most European hotel bathrooms, and well-appointed. The hotel has a very nice dining room, with a panoramic view, and a great breakfast spread. Complimentary newspapers, including The International Herald Tribune, were available in the lobby in the morning. The staff members, all of whom spoke English, were very nice. They made restaurant reservations and secured a taxi to the airport for us. We will stay there again on our next trip to Madrid (that we are already talking about a return trip is owed in part to this hotel) and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Gloskeith
Reviews.Content: I think this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Okay, I usually look for a real bargain, but this wasn't exactly a budget-busting price. It was worth every single cent. The hotel is beautiful - from the wonderful antique lift (don't worry, there's a modern one, too) to the stunning lobby. The rooms are spacious, very clean and well equipped. And the staff are extremely friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was a joy. There was a wde variety of items to choose from and you ate in the sixth floor restaurant with a spectacular view of Madrid. It's also worth mentioning that there was free wi-fi access. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandinka_11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 nights. First impressions: Very clean hotel and friendly staff. Rooms were cleaned daily. I fell in love with the old fashioned lift, you must give it a try. I can't comment on the food as we had room only. The hotel is within a 2 minute walk from the main strip likewise to the metro station - Opera. The hotel is next to a Convent and the bells ring out approximately 18:30 which didn't bother my partner or me. We had a wonderful time in Madrid and would definitely go back. Sight - Seeing, take a ride on the Cable Car which gives you great views of the City, take a trip to the Bull Ring even if it's just to look round and not to watch a Bull Fight, note Bull Fights are on Sunday's. A visit to Plaza Mayor and watch the world go by. Have fun...............

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ANA1958
Reviews.Content: My husband and my self stayed for a night returning from a a cruise, the room was spacious and the decor was beautiful. the area was excellent if you want to shop also the area had many restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after carefully reading through other Tripadvisor Reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is situated in the old city, close to restaurants, shops and many popular tourist attractions of the old city. There are a couple of metro stations close by, but once we have got your bearings, Madrid is not that big and walking around is easy; we did not use the metro. To get to the hotel from the airport we chose to take the Metro from the airport to Nuevos Ministerios Metro station, which departs the airport every 5 minutes and costs 2 Euro. To get to the hotel by metro looked a bit difficult (need to change lines once or twice) so we got a taxi from Nuevos Ministerios to the hotel, for under 10 Euros, so all up, the cost was around 14 Euros. The hotel is situated in a charming old building in a quite location, which has been modernised. I believe the building used to house the American Embassy around the early part of the 20th Century. Check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was not large but very tastefully furnished and quiet. Our roomed overlooked the interior courtyard. Good bathroom (shower over bath). Mini bar and safe, and the mini bar stock was very reasonably priced compared to most international hotels. As we arrived a little late and decided not to go out and eat, but arranged some tapas through room service, which was excellent and reasonably priced. Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the top floor, with some lovely views over the roof tops of the old city. Our tariff included breakfast, which was a buffet (European style), but you could order hot egg dishes. Try the fried eggs with some of the local ham. They are the best fried eggs I have ever tasted. If breakfast is not included in your room rate, I am told that the breakfast buffet is very expensive. Wi fi internet is available free of charge. Ask at the front desk for a password. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our three nights at the Palacio San Marco and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy 4 star in good location in old city area”
Reviews.Author: John2a
Reviews.Content: This is well priced and sophisticated, without being in the super classy league. Its on pretty San Martin Plaza, with easy walking to Plaza Mayor, the royal palace, and the Gran Via. There's a very toney downstairs bar that's hard to walk past, and terrific Spanish buffet breakfasts in the upstairs restaurant. It's surrounded by a heap of restaurants and tapa bars, in the maze of little streets around it.. We stayed here twice (based on TripAdvisor comments) and both times the rooms were smallish - this is Europe - but very nicely decorated. We had pleasant city street views on both occasions and I suspect the aspects into the hotel's courtyard are also nice. Easy to recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intur Palacio and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: melizm
Reviews.Content: Six nights and we didn't want to leave. Large airy, comfortable room with equally pleasing bathroom; wonderful breakfast; attentive staff; and in a great location. It can't possibly get better for the discriminating traveller who appreciates quality that is nicely priced. For added pleasure, try a "pick up" dinner (weekdays only) at the Mercado San Miguel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annabel16
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a solid, well-located hotel and were pleasantly surprised to discover that and so much more. This hotel is far more beautiful and romantic than the web site or the pictures here are able to convey, and the staff is professional and kind. It's a great location, convenient to Plaza Isabel and Plaza del Sol, tucked away next to a convent. The value was amazing, I can't think why they don't charge more!

Reviews.Title: “A great starting point in Spain”
Reviews.Author: DeniseScott
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very accomodating to us during our 3 nights in Madrid. Location is excellent for all sights and we only used the Metro to get out for the bull fight. They do not offer breakfast, but you can easily get that at other places. We found Cafe & Te to be a good stop for an easy breakfast. Our room had a good sized balcony and an extra sitting room so there was plenty of space to relax. We didn't do the breakfast, but it looked OK and gave you an excellent view of the city. We slept well there and felt comfortable walking in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: lws1515
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for two nights during an extensive stay in spain. What a great location in a large city! It was near everything we wanted to see or at least an inexpensive taxi ride. The hotel was clean and quiet- our room was a nice size with a big bathroom. The breakfast was superb and extensive with cooked eggs to order. I would stay there again while in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good choice”
Reviews.Author: perlo99
Reviews.Content: Hotel choosen after a careful look at tripadvisor as always. No disapointment. We have had room 506 at Euro 135.- per night and stayed two nights. Not hudge room but OK. We asked for a quiet room and indeed the window was on the internal patio and we have had no noise at all. Staff has been efficient. Cleaning. Good choice at brekfast time which was by the way included in the above mentionned price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - after initial reaction to smallish room”
Reviews.Author: NA1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 7th - 15th. Initial reaction was slight dissapointment to smaller than expected room. However the hotel had honoured our request for a quiet inner room so maybe this was the reason for the smaller room. We only heard the monastery bells once on the first morning 6.30am, but after that we didnt hear them. Room very comfortable, fridge useful for keeping provisions from El Cortes Igles supermarket. Free wifi internet consistently good although speed not mega fast for streaming. We felt 'at home' the 8 days we stayed here. Didnt have the buffet breakfast bit pricey for us as we dont eat much for breakfast (2 starbucks 3 minutes walk away) Staff pleasant + helpful, gave us a 3pm checkout last day to make our lives easier as we had a 5.30 Easyjet flight back to the UK Booked on a deal through Lastminute.com when they had a 15% 'sale' promotion worked out around £75 room only - good value for excellent location, peace and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TimeoutLakeport
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Great location. Easy walk to the Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace, the Puerta del Sol (which was taken over at the time by a messy group of tent people making a political statemnt--a shame). There are all kinds of cafes and shops in the neighborhood, including a Corte Ingles. This hotel looks right out on a quiet cute little plaza with a sidewalk cafe that closes at 11 pm. You can people watch from your balcony! The maid service was excellent. Each day she did the room like you were arriving for the first time. Room service was prompt too. It had one of those cute funky wrought iron elevators that was faster than the conventional one. The breakfast buffet is for those on expense accts. Forget it, go out to a cafe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FredaWarrington
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, reception staff friendly and helpful. We had an internal room no problem as we were room only. Room not large but adequate as we were only there to get changed at night and to sleep there.. Bed comfy. Bathroom amenities very good with razor, toothbrush and toothpaste, comb etc. Large white fluffy towels. Minutes walk away from Metro and shops. Can't comment on the food at this hotel, as we were room only and went out for breakfast and meals. Very quiet location with no road passing the hotel. Would definitely stay there again if we went back to Madrid, which is a very vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelersNY
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room facing Plaza where a cafe was set up. No homeless around. Some noise thru bathroom window no problem; no noise thru double glazed bedroom window. Almost spotless, except for a trace of black mold in tub/shower. Accommodating staff. Reasonable rates. Did not have breakfast(12Epp)-American breakfast available for half nearby. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location if you can get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleALuton
Reviews.Content: In agreement with everyone about the location of this hotel, however, also in agreement with those that the rooms are a little tired and ours was quite dark too. Bathrooms in comparison were nice though. Also found some of the staff unfriendly and unhelpful compared to other higher quality hotels where you might expect the staff to be a bit stand offish. My other main complaint was that the taxi we booked via the hotel back to the airport completely ripped us off - it was more than the one from the airport which you would not expect at all - whether the hotel gets a kick back or not I don't know but if so, they should stop as we literally just had enough money to pay having allowed a similar amount to to the one from the airport. Breakfast was the best thing apart from the location but only if you can get a good deal including the breakfast. Search all websites for comparisons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PWRBECKS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrically located, several Metro stations, shops, and restaurants within walking distance. Easy access to La Gran Via, Plaza del Sol, Mercado de San Miguel, etc Free WIFI access with plenty routers that really gives you great signal in every floor, and also enables you to be connected in two devices at once. The room was very comfortable and roomy, the bed was squeaky. The only thing (and it really did not bother me) that can be an issue for some people is that the hotel is located next to a convent, and it's bells go off at 6:30 am, and depending in room locating they can be heard.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hotel on 2 week trip to Spain”
Reviews.Author: DebbyLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning and end of trip Starting early April 2011. 102E rooms and added a day Over Easter end of trip for 148E I'd stay here if I came to Madrid again and recommend it highly The 102E room was not inthe basement as I had feared (check out website) ●Very central location- Plaza de Sol, Metros, pedestiran shopping streets, Palace, Chocolateria San Gines, Cava Baja tapas area, good restuarnts close by, walking distance to Prado(downhill- taxi if lazy back) etc. ●Air conditioning is great - was 80+F in April and could get room as cold as wanted ●For European room very large and higher priced room gigantic. Beds comfortable. ●Quiet- windows then inside that double window- all french doors. We had 3 different rooms in total 1 start of stay and 2 end of stay. We could hear the 6:30 convent bells in only one corner room facing the convent and then if only a very light sleeper. No late night reveling outside. One one street in front but Plaza between street and hotel ●Safe area at night, shopping on pedestrian streets 1 block away in 3 directions ●Very helpful staff (not all were smiley but all very attentive) ●Website easy to book and cancel (our friends had to cancel). Accurately reflects what rooms and hotel actually looks like ●Wifi worked in all rooms. Hotel management had put in mult nodes. Our IPad reception was wonderful and no charge. ●. Across the street from Roomate Laura if you can't find on google. We did not eat brkfast here or use the gymn or sauna so can't comment on them. Tip: tell taxi driver to go up Calle Hileras,drive cross pedestrian street and turn right on San Marcos Plaza or you may be let out on the walk street. Go the same way for 24hr underground public parking 50 feet from the hotel (we did not get a car in town). less than 10E to Atocha station by cab, 30E to airport 30 min (43E and 40-45 min if going to British Air as a different terminal)

Reviews.Title: “ok stay at best!!”
Reviews.Author: ELLABLEUE
Reviews.Content: After traveling to the French Mediterrenean, it was time to return for the 3rd time to one of my favorite places, Madrid.. For my 3rd stay in Madrid, I chose Intur san Palacio. Lets start with the pros, the hotel is located in Puerto del sol, in the middle of the city.. Basically, you have access to the Metro, night clubs, cheap eatings etc... On to the cons, the decor gave me a headache, its very victorian and outdated..Lets move to the staff, they were not fluent in English, somewhat professional but not friendly. They appeared not to know the city and would often give us the wrong directions. In my humble opinion, it was ok at best.. I have seen better in Madrid..

Reviews.Title: “Computer stolen from my hotel room - Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: loginpermanente
Reviews.Content: During my absence from my hotel room, my suitcase was searched and my computer was stolen. At the time of the theft, at midnight, I didn't get any assistance from the hotel staff . After a week, I recovered my computer that was sold in the thieves market. I had to write myself to Hotels.com to have my hotel night reimbursed. The hotel didn't pay for any of the expenses I had because of the theft (change of hotel, telephone calls, new software, travel). AWFUL EXPERIENCE

Reviews.Title: “Location, price, comfort and luxury. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: As most hidden gems, coming out of Metro Opera station not many were acquainted with the location of the hotel. Ask for directions to Monasterio de las Dezcalsas Reales and walk a couple of blocks up to the hotel. The price quoted for a reservation made the luxurious facade a bit suspicious, could it be too good to be true? It really was. From the attentive and friendly staff, you'd be delighted to stay in a facility that somehow manages to bring together price, service, luxury and location - all in one. It is not only a rarity in Europe but in most major cities in the world. The beds are extremely comfortable and the authentic decor between the classic and the modern go together perfectly. We didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but the menu made it seem up to the standards. There is a very small fitness facility too. Palacio Real and other major attractions as Gran Via are just a few steps away. Local shops, pubs and nightclubs are very close too. Being so close to where the action is in Madrid, the hotel also manages to give you an extremely quiet and peaceful atmosphere. TIP: Don't rush to use the modern elevator and try the old fashioned/authentic manual elevator which is still in service. It will add to your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Hotel Close to All Major Sites and Quiet Too”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoYan
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Intur Palacio San Martin in Madrid for 4 nights. It is beautiful with 19th century style, every graceful and elegant. It is next to a royal convent, acrossed the street is Caja Madrid, a culture fundation with exhibition associated with the Thysen Bornemisa Museum. You see people lined up to visit the convent around the corner. But it is very quiet at night. It is walking distance to most of the sites: Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Museo del Prado, Museo Thysen Bornemisa, Parque del Retiro, the Royal Palace. The area has many stores and restaurants. The only place we took the subway to is Reina Sofia, the modern art museum. We took the airport express bus (2 euro per person) to Atocha Renfe (railway station), then took a taxi to the hotel on a Saturday which costed 12 euro. I recommend this way to and from the airport. It is a long long way to go by taxi only and would be very expensive. The hotel has a restaurant and bar, gym too. The best thing offered by the hotel is the map. Please ask for this map at the front desk before you venture out, it will save you from getting lost in the meandering streets and little plazas. I bought a Streetwise map for Madrid before my trip and got another city map from the Tourist Information center, but it is the map I got from the hotel I use everyday. This hotel has free Wi-Fi too, just ask for the code at the front desk. There is a computer near the lobby for guests, but no printer. You need to e-mail your airline boarding pass to the hotel and they will print it for you. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Exploring City!”
Reviews.Author: Dante_the_Florentine
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel to use as your base for exploring Madrid. Central to the city and perfect for walking and taking in all the sites. The rooms although small (US comparisons) are completely comfortable and well equipped. We were disappointed our room only had a view of the internal courtyard, however all other aspects met our expectations. After a few days touring the city, we received recommendations from the front desk for a restaurant; La Finca de Susana, which turned out to be one of our favorite romantic meals during our two week stay in Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: psmythWaringstown
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation close to metro stations and in the middle of the old part of town. The hotel itself is very clean and extremely comfortable. Previous reviews complained about the reception staff. In my opinion they were very polite and helpful without being intrusive. If you want a bunch of redcoats behind the counter go to Butlins. The bedrooms were well equipped with all the usual bits and pieces and two big twin beds pushed together which were very comfortable. After reading another review we requested a room overlooking the square. There was only one left which our friends got and was like a suite, much bigger than ours. The breakfast was first class all the fruit, cereals, hams/meatsand cheeses you could eat and a selection of cooked breakfasts as well.We didn't get a chance to try out the gym so can't comment. The bar is very small and in the foyer and you have to go to the reception to get a member of staff to serve you but this was only a few steps away so no great problem.This is a relatively small hotel in a lovely area of town which is nice and quiet and night with very comfortable rooms. All in all it was exactly the sort of hotel that we like and I would have no problem in reccomending it to anybody. If you go to the Plaza Mayor there is a beautiful old tapas bar adorned with bulls heads and lots of old photos of bullfights and celebrities who have frequnted it in the past. this is a beutiful little bar but be warned. We ordered a small plate of seafood and one of ham and were charged 50 euros so as much as we enjoyed it make sure and ask the price of your food first.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Perriard
Reviews.Content: Comfortable 4-star hotel, excellent breakfast (buffet), within walking distance of many interesting sites. Restaurants, shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Paul046
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of February with 8 other couples. Spacious clean rooms, very quiet, friendly staff and a fantastic location being only a 5 minute stroll to the Puerta del sol and a 10 minute stroll to the palace. Loads of bars and restaurants again all within easy walking distance. Whilst the breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice, my only negative comment would be that the hotel needed additional breakfast staff to serve / clear up. This is only a minor criticism and certainly did not spoil our stay at this hotel. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel and would recommend this hotel to anyone visting the beautiful and vibrant city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: VenS
Reviews.Content: I will agree with previous ratings. This is a great hotel to visit Madrid. Excellent location,walking distance to all major attractions, near pedestrianized calle Arenal and Sol area and 3 metro stations. Breakfast excellent, room great, beds very comfortable, wi-fi in the room, bathroom and room cleaned everyday and new towels and bathroom extras supplied every day, powerful hairdryer,safe in the room,v.quiet room although overlooking the alley,staff v.polite and helpful. OTHER TIPS: (1) VALOR cafe next to the hotel has excellent coffees and churros (2) LA RUE in the Malasana area (calle Espiritu Santo 18) has great crepes

Reviews.Title: “A charming, peaceful haven only minutes from the buzz of the city”
Reviews.Author: Jen2Lions
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous location! Literally a few minutes walk to three metro stations (giving access to the red, blue, green and yellow lines) and five minutes to Plaza Mayor (when you cross C/Arenal and use C/Bordadores as a shortcut). So close to the bustle, yet set in a beautiful old building in a tranquil square - perfect! Transport: the airport bus costs 2 euros to Cibeles, then go round the corner to the metro, red line, Banco de Espana - 1 euro ticket ('sencillo') for 3 stops to Opera, then it's just a few minutes walk along C/Arenal, 4th on the left! A taxi back to the airport costs about 30 euros. Our room (207) was not the prettiest, but had a modern bathroom with a powerful shower, and being at the end of the corridor, was very quiet and restful. It was cleaned well each day, generally whilst we were having breakfast. There's a lovely little lounge beside the bar, although we preferred to sit under the atrium with a glass of rioja - which was not expensive at all. I can highly recommend taking breakfast in the hotel - it's well worth the few euros when you make the reservation. The choice of cold meats, breads, cheeses, pastries, cereals and fresh fruit was extensive, and a glass of cava with breakfast added to the sense of luxury. Hot food was also available on request. I was a bit disappointed with the coffee... but then had I have asked, they'd probably have brought me something stronger. Staff in the restaurant and on reception were friendly and helpful, being happy to recommend a great flamenco show (Cafe de Chinitas, C/Torija) and make a phone call to reserve our tickets. Good eateries very close by are Rineon de Roque (C/San Martin) and Carpe Diem (Postigo de San Martin). We're planning to make a return trip to Madrid (there's just so much to see and do) and will definitely stay at the San Martin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff helpful and courteous, marvellous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: susiesincharge
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel becxause my friends had been there. I was very pleased with the room, the location and the courteous staff. My room was spacious and very clean. The breakfast choice was excellent although the waitresses could have smiled occasionally. That was the only negative. The concierge was helpful and I could use Internet in the lounge anytime I wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location in Old Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jcandnc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - the building has great architectural features which weren't so evident in the rooms. Staff were really helpful and mostly spoke English. The room was a good size, spotlessly clean and had everything we would hope for plus.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: scjr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were comfortable and well furnished in a style that provided a little old-fashioned charm without being dated. bathroom, though small was very clean and well-supplied with toiletries and towels. A wide range of options were provided at breakfast with an especially good selection of fresh fruits. The view over Madrid's rooftops from the resturant was also a treat on a sunny morning. Our courtyard view room was extremely quiet. I've noticed a complaints here about the double beds being two singles pushed together but my partner and i had no problem with this and we slept comfortably throughout the stay. It may be worth noting, as others have, that the interior courtyard is covered by a glass roof. During the cool days of February this was no problem for us but it might be less comfortable in the height of summer. The room's heating and aircon system was very efficient, however. The staff were pleasant and courteous. The location of the hotel is excellent - a couple of minutes form metro Callao and within walking distance of all main sights - Palacio Real, Prado, Centro de Arte Reina Sofia - as well as a variety of different neighbourhoods - Chueca, La Latina, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Santa Ana are all within easy reach. Some visitors have mentioned the presence of homeless people near the hotel. We did notice a couple of people in the street just round the corner but never felt uncomfortable walking around the area either during the day or at night. All in all, I would certainly recommend San Martin as a relaxing retreat that still manages to keep its guests close to the hustle, bustle and history of central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay if you want to discover Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BOZ90
Reviews.Content: Best location, cosy room, good breafast, helpful and resposive personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Kenglehardtrd
Reviews.Content: Liked the location, rooms were clean, cute balconey, rooms smelled little like smoke, beds were hard, good breakfast food with bad coffee

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and style of hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonnewportgwent
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel. Booked through Travel Republic, who again were excellent. Location couldn't have been better. Two minutes from Gran Via and Corte Ingles, four minutes from Puerta De Sol and five minutes from Palacio Real behind the Opera House. Hotel in lovely plaza opposite the convent Descalzas, hence no traffic noise. Staff were excellent, room overlooking plaza was a big bonus. Our room very spacious with all amenities,exllellent breakfast choice served in the restuarant on the 6th floor with a fantastic view over the city. Having travelled to many cities in Spain, this is one of the best we have stayed in. A couple of tips; we used the Airport bus( 2 euros) to take us to Cibeles and took a very short taxi ride to the hotel( 10 euros) . A very helpful Spanish lady told us to wave down a taxi as it is cheaper than taking one from a taxi rank. Plaza de Santa Ana is excellent for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Richard0304
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel is flanked by two enormous antique entry doors. The glass canopied main lobby, located in an inner courtyard has a bar and newspapers. The room (#415) is spacious with a large bathroom. A cozy, but generously proportioned inset fit a writing table for a laptop and free WiFi. There is a refrigerator, safe, nice furnishings with a firm bed. The ceilings are quite high. Its small window opens onto an airshaft (other rooms open onto a glass covered inner courtyard or onto the street and had larger windows with more light). However, I opted for a quiet room - a reasonable tradeoff. There is an antique and functional elevator (to supplement the modern one) which glided smoothly through the center core of an elegant, wooden stairwell. The carefully tooled exterior cast iron door led to the gleaming wooden saloon doors of the elevator cab which were opened manually and outfitted with bevelled glass panes. The hotel is centrally situated: within a short walk to several Metro stations: Opera, Sol, Callao and Sevilla. Many sights are also a short walk - the longest being 20 minutes: La Plaza Mayor (8 minutes), Puerta del Sol (5 minutes), Mercado San Miguel (8 minutes), the Thyssen-Bornemisza, El Prado, and the Museo del Real Academia de Bellas Artes de San Fernando (a real find only 5 minutes from Sol), Casa Labra (for their famous bacalao tapas - 5 minutes), and the Palacio Real (10 minutes). Also nearby on Plaza del Sol is the wonderful La Mallorquina for coffee and a pastry - a real taste of Spain. The front desk staff were always helpful and I think they all spoke English (but I only spoke Spanish while in Spain). I would not hesitate to return to this venue.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: AnyaM
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this little gem! We spent almost a week and a half in Madrid and Intur Palacio San Martin truly became our home. Wonderful location, beautiful rooms and amazing service. Before the trip I've researched so many places to stay, read so many reviews that eventually i was so overwhelmed i didn't even want to go anywhere, haha. Intur Palacio was in our modest price range so my expectations were on a lower end, how wrong I was! It's a perfect place to stay in Madrid, throughout the whole stay my husband and parents kept thanking me for finding that place and couldn't be happier with our hotel. Here is something we did and I found to be a great idea. Hotel is placed really close to the mall El Corte Inglés, on ground floor they have a grocery store! Instead of having lunch out (which can get very pricey ) we would get wine, gazpacho, hamon, olives, fruits... Not more that 15ueros for 4 of us. We'll eat it in a hotel room, drinking wine and having lovely conversations. This strategy kept our men :) full and happy till dinner. I can't wait to be back in Madrid and stay in Intur Palacio San Martin (THANK YOU!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great ocation, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: phuketexpats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The location is excellent, in a quiet little street just behind the main shopping area & the building is a traditional Spanish restoration. You can walk everywhere, subway is also a few minutes walk. There is also a big El Corte Inglis department store just up the street which has a big supermarket in basement. The rooms are ok, ours was a bit small & showing signs of wear, but still quite acceptable. Breakfast was good & free wifi in rooms was a bonus.The price was very reasonable for a good quality hotel in the center of Madrid. Only complaint would be the desk staff were a bit reserved & not overly approachable, but overall would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Beardownbob
Reviews.Content: The Palacio San Martin was fabulous. Close to the Puerto del Sol and several Metro stops. Very clean, all of the amenities and a very helpful staff. I told the front desk I was looking for a locals only restaurant, no tourists. Boy did he pick a great one with Galicia/Asturian specialties. Fresh octopus (Pulpo) was excellent! We hope to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellers-Ont
Reviews.Content: hotel is very centrally located, very clean, front desk staff are a bit reserved but overall hotel was good and would recommend staying there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ontheqt
Reviews.Content: San Martin is in a great place for cruising Tapas Bars and chilling out through the day. One can walk to most attractions in Madrid and there are 3 Metro stations within a couple of minutes walk, yet the lacation is incredibly quiet (we did not have the convent bell ringing in our room). Ou room was nothing special. Adequate size and sightly tired. It would have been very restful if it wasn't for the plumbing knocking 24/7. As the whole hotel would have hear this, I don't think it would have gone unnoticed, so I hope that it was a temporary issue. I normally prefer to find breakfast outside hotels, but it was inlcuded in our rate and did not dissappoint. There was Cava and Jamon available every day and different sweets. Thy offered to make Tortila, eggs, bacon fresh, but we ever took them up on this offer as there were plenty of other choices available. I would not hezitate to recommend this hotel to others, but we still have our favourite in Madrid which is yet to be beaten. Unfortunately (perhaps thanks to tripadviser reviews) we never seem to be able to get a reservation there any more because its always fully booked or too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in central madrid”
Reviews.Author: Fallaoimh
Reviews.Content: A Hotel with some character in its decoration and layout. From my first email requesting a room over the square to check out, a very pleasant experience in dealing with this hotel. Its pretty central and once you get your bearings you can walk "in the rain" as we found, to just about anywhere in central madrid. Plenty of resturants and bars in the area and you can spend a couple of hours in El Cortes department store round the corner, don't forget to get your 10% discount card at the info. desk, if you plan to do some shopping. Breakfast in the hotel dining area on the 6th floor offers a lovely view of the city. Plenty of choice for all and if you needed a hot option can be ordered. Theres a great buzz, and plenty to see for all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and character”
Reviews.Author: centra3k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - close to metro stations and not on a busy noisy street. Its decor has not been "Euro-modernized", the rooms are very comfortable and the staff is very nice. Breakfast is excellent and is on the top floor, affording rooftop views of Madrid to the south. If you just have to go to Puerta del Sol or Plaza Major, you can walk there in a few minutes. If you're really in a walking mood, you can also walk to the Prado, Thiessen and Reina Sofia museums from here, but the Metro is so easy I recommend that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very central position close to the Opera and is a perfect base for exploring Madrids main attractions. We didn't use the metro as everything was easy walking distance. The Hotel is in a quiet Square right next to the Barefoot Royals Monastery but with the double windows there was no noise at all and we overlooked a busy street. Staff were helpful and efficient but could be a bit more cheery. The hotel is full of old world charm and the resrtaurant/breakfast is on the top floor with spectacular rooftop views over the city.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: wardyp
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in early September, if you want a hotel with character in a central location this is hard to beat. A standard room is 90 euro and whilst not huge, very good value. A short walk to Plaza Major and all the sites of central Madrid. Surrounded by tapas bars and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem”
Reviews.Author: spikeynorman
Reviews.Content: great hotel and location,very friendly and helpful staff,lovely room.Only downside is the church bells ringing about 5am in the morning - boy were they loud.Even so didn't spoil our stay.A must visit is the Mercado de San Miguel for great tapas and wine.Will definitely go back to the hotel and Madrid

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, good common areas, nice room, awesome view”
Reviews.Author: MaxArag
Reviews.Content: For me, this is the perfect location -- right in the heart of Madrid -- 2 minutes walk to Plaza Sol, 5 minutes to Plaza Mayor, but still quiet and peaceful in the little Plaza San Martin. Hotel has the charm of an older building, but all modern comforts. Will make this my home base again in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: tiffany_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. We had a small, dark room that over looked the court yard and the other three walls of the hotel. I didn't really think the service was that great either. The one nice thing about this hotel was that it was very centrally located right next to Puerto del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Madrid center”
Reviews.Author: Theresehols
Reviews.Content: An excellent 4 star hotel right in th center of Madrid. Only 5 minute walk from the main plaza -Plaza Major. Rooms very nicely furnished. Large bed. Great bathroom with fluffy towels and lots of free toiletries Great air-conditioning. Lovely breakfast room on top floor with views over city. very helpful staff. Free Wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IloveLiquorice
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Palacio San Martin. The location was very convenient and was within walking distance from the main shopping areas, the Plaza de Mayor and the La Latina barios where there are plenty of good tapas bars. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and in spite of the central location, the rooms were very quiet. We had breakfast included in our tariff, there was a good variety of food on offer and cooked breakfast at no extra charge was also available. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were very prompt to respond when the safe in our room decided to malfunction and kept bleeping (!) and were very helpful in printing our boarding pass and allowing us to check out late. All in all, we enjoyed our stay in Madrid and this hotel met our needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms, clean and quaint property”
Reviews.Author: Mrfamilyvacation
Reviews.Content: You simply cannot get a better location. Restaurants, grocery store, tapas bars, famous plazas, metro and random shopping are all within a short walk of the hotel. Staff spoke English which was helpful for tourist guidance. There is a small but nice gym in a converted guest room. Water pressure in showers was great. The old-time elevator was a hit with the kids and the wooden floors in central stairs adds an antique feel. Non smoking facility at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYCNative51
Reviews.Content: Large room with soundproof windows so that even when the crowds were partying in Plaza San Martin, we were in total silence. Friendly staff, great location for tourists. I'd stay again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb central location”
Reviews.Author: Koenraad21031986
Reviews.Content: Palacio San Martin is an exquisite hotel in the very heart of central Madrid, ideally for exploring all the mayor monuments, attractions and famous places by foot in a very short distance. Its superb location makes this hotel a perfect choice for those who are looking for a good place to stay during a city-trip. Surprisingly, the 'Plaza San Martin' where the hotel is located, is a quiet, very nice plaza, and there is absolutely no disturbing noise from the city in the hotelrooms: a quiet, good night of sleep is guarenteed. Service is excellent and morning breakfast overwhelming and of perfect quality. This hotel is without a doubt a fantastic choice and deliveres absolutely an enourmous great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reliable air-conditioning, and quiet area”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Puerto del Sol, Plaza Mayor and three Metro stations. It is located on a quiet and peaceful square. The reception desk is tiny and we walked right past. Our room, number 203, is comfortable and average in size. The bathroom was sparkling clean. The shower/tub has nice fixtures and good water pressure. There are plenty of towels. The amenities are extensive but just average in quality. It’s probably a law that four star hotels must provide a comb, shampoo, soap, shaving kit and toothbrush/paste. Body lotion and condition are not. The bed is average, the sheets are very good, and the pillows are flat. We asked for extras and better pillows were promptly delivered. Most important for summer travelers, the air-conditioning is good and the room was always cool when we returned. The breakfast is served on the top floor. It wasn’t included with our room so we would have been charged 12 Euros each. So we ate at a café down the street. We read that the building was once an Embassy. It is historical and interesting; especially the old fashioned elevator. Free wi-fi is accessible in the rooms. The lobby has one computer with free internet access. The front desk is equipped to print for guests. The hotel service is low-key but certainly accommodates requests. This hotel is a good choice for travelers who use public transportation, want a good room at a reasonable rate, require reliable modern conveniences, and don’t want to be fussed over by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every category - very rare”
Reviews.Author: paulbru
Reviews.Content: This is an historic building with modern hotel rooms inside. It's located in the central district, equidistant from three main metro stations (Sol, Callao and Opera). However, it's in a pedestrianised area so it's very quiet in the rooms. The front desk formalities were fast and friendly (printed my boarding pass and offered to take my suitcases from my room). Wireless internet is free throughout the hotel (this is one of my criteria for choosing an hotel). A lot of the five-star big brands I stay in (Hilton, Four Seasons etc) could learn a lot from the San Martin. This was a first-class experience and it cost only 90 EURO a night. I should say that I took my simple breakfast in a nearby bar so can't comment on the restaurant. This will be my preferred hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Lily07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in Madrid. We booked into a junior suite that was very spacious and conveyed an old world charm. We absolutely would stay here again. Pros for junior suite: Large and comfortable, though the balcony not usable for sitting Concierge helpful Free wi fi Location very handy to everything but also pretty quiet Next to pedestrian walkway so traffic noise is light The homeless that hung out in front of the hotel are no longer in Plaza San Martin Cons Smoke permeates the room at times though it’s supposed to be a smoke free facility (European travelers break these rules constantly) Service in the bar is uneven Bells from near by church toll at 6:30 (30 bells) then every 15 mins throughout the day

Reviews.Title: “A five-star location... fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sjgjess1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the big five stars in town, and here's the deal: They are far from the action. The Inturn Palacio is not terribly updated; the carpets are clean, but anachronistic, while the wood floors are quaint, but unpolished. It just longs for a fresh overhaul. However, I can tell you that when I go back to Madrid in a week, we're probably going to stay there again. I thought I valued the bathrobes and the pillow menus that other hotels offer, but in Madrid, it's all about the city. If I were you, I would stay away from the Gran Via and get to know the Opera neighborhood. It's a stone's throw from the Gran Via, a short jaunt to the Plaza Mayor, and a straight shot to the unparalleled nightlife of La Latina. If there were a five star hotel in this neighborhood, I would stay there, but there just isn't. In that area of town, there is no hotel as quiet and as personal as the Hotel Intur Palacio. Yes, I have stayed in nicer places, but this little gem has scored big points with this tricky traveler. Nice gym, by the way, and that seems to go unmentioned on everything I've read.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel with good rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mf300
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet but very near lots of restaurants.The room was a double junior suite . It was a very large room, with a separate sitting are and balcony. We were on the 5th floor-The balcony faced towards the back and was a fairly high concrete wall. Would have beeen nice to have some furniture outside. I would say service was very low key, usually just one person at the desk, but fine for me -although the receptionist was very helpful when I had my bag stolen. Nice cafe sets up in the courtyard oustide the hotel (belongs to another restaurant) and good museum oppposite and next door.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hanzel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location with a wonderful staff. The rooms were not large but were adequate. The breakfast was good and the breakfast room had wonderful views of the city rooftops. Much of what we wanted to see was in walking distance and it was easy to catch transportation to take you to the museume area. There was free internet and wi fi hook up. The staff was very helpful when we needed help with a reservation for later in our trip. I highly reccomend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, accomodation, staff - and value for money too.”
Reviews.Author: steve41Uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel with character. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who spoke brilliant English - they even held rooms for us until the evening in case we returned from the airport due to volcanic ash flight cancellation. Location could not be better, within easy walking distance of all the Old Madrid attractions and loads of restaurants, yet away from the crowds in a quiet square. Our room overlooked the Plaza. Great 6th floor restaurant with skyline views: fantastic choice of buffet breakfast - best quality fruit we've ever seen - also cooked English to order. Evening meal also first class. Waiters very efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good news, bad news”
Reviews.Author: RichardWynne
Reviews.Content: Good news: the location is excellent, the best you can get, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the views from the restsurant on the 6th floor are superb. See if you can get a room looking out onto the Plaza San Martin. The bad news: the attitude of some of the staff leave a lot to be desired, the 'cant be nothered' attitude of Antonio especially. The bar is not always manned, and you have to yrll for serrvice. Breakfast on the 6th floor is OK, but nothing special (although the maitre d' looks like Brendan from Ballykissangel). Do not believe that all the advertised services are offered.
