We wanted to exchange a travellers cheque, and were told it all depended on hether he had taken any cash that morning, (and this on Easter Monday). The fire alarms tend to go off accidentally during the night, and the hotel itself has very littler atmosphere. I did not nmotice this attirude with non English or non American couples. I tried out my limited Spanish in the hotel, and was treated with contempt. Would I stay there again, NO, definitely NO. There are hotels all over Madrid that are more reasonably priced and hopefully with staff who have a better attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TACOB0B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid March 2010. This was a great location right in between the Callao and Sol metro stations. Plenty of restaurants in the area. The Cortes Ingles major department store was one street over. The staff was friendly, the rooms were a good size, we asked for an inside room and heard absolutely no street noise at all. The bed was comfortable and there was no extra charge for the safe in the room. However we should note a few issues with this hotel. The hotel and the room was very clean however, there was a sewage odor in the bathroom that seemed to come and go. Also having a king size bed in Europe is not the norm. What we had was two twins pushed together but there was no padding in-between and had individual sheets so for a couple it was not convenient but was comfortable for sleeping. The pillows were great. Having an inside room was great for controlling the noise for being in the heart of the city and you had a window that opened up into what seemed to be a sky lit atrium but the atrium had a glass roof which I am sure was helping with the noise but allowed for no fresh air. The Hotel supplies you with everything you could need and if you do need something they will give it to you, including directions to different types of restaurants i.e Indian and Chinese if local cuisine is not your thing. We were on the third floor and breakfast was served each morning on the sixth floor. The hotel only has 1 elevator which could only hold 4 people max so trying to get to breakfast via the elevator could take a while. Once on the sixth floor, when standing, there was a view of the city which was great for determining the weather for the day. The breakfast buffet compared to our stay in Barcelona was outstanding. There were at least 8 different types of fresh fruit each morning along with several types of hams, cheeses, breads, and pastries. There was also cereals, yogurts, and an ice cold bottle of cava each morning. The coffee was unbelievable, YUM! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: JCP1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intur Palacio San Martin in early March for five nights. Upon arrival we discovered our room looked inwards to what had been a courtyard but was now glassed in - both at roof level and above the lobby/bar level. As the hotel was very warm and we had no fresh air on opening the windows we asked to be moved to an outside room and we were moved immediately. There was no extra charge for this room. The rooms are spacious, well stocked toiletries, spotlessly clean and comfortable. The hotel is situated in as quiet an area as you can probably find in downtown Madrid and could not have been handier for walking to most of the main sights one would want to see. It is also surrounded by restaurants, as well as having its own, and one can also enjoy a meal in the 'courtyard' or the sittings rooms (very comfortable) at the bar area and enjoy their excellent food. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful at all times. We booked our stay here over the internet and feel that the rate charged for this 4* hotel was excellent value. I would strongly recommend the Hotel Intur Palacio San Martin to anyone wishing to stay in Madrid for any length of time, and we would most definitely stay there again should we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location--exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: wittliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect location for exploring all the tourist sites in Madrid. Located on a very quiet square in Madrid, just south of the Gran Via. Our room was very large by European standards and the bathroom was very nice and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We booked through epoquehotels.com and got a great rate. Our room also had a small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Spain”
Reviews.Author: LG23
Reviews.Content: This gracious, historic hotel is a gem. My room was enormous and furnished in an opulent 19th century style. The breakfast room has a panoramic view over the surrounding roof tops and the food is fresh, delicious and plentiful. It is extremely convenient and quiet. I strongly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Juno27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September last year. We found a good deal on their website (88 euro per night). The location is great. It's in the city center and walking distance to major attractions. One problem was morning church bell at 6am, which lasted about 30 seconds. Depends on the day, we heard the bells several times in the morning. Our room was facing the plaza, it was very loud and woke us up every morning. Since not many people reported this problem, it may not be a problem if you stay in courtyard view room. Our room 502 was very small... you can only walk around the bed. Luckily we were asked to move to 510 next day due to bathroom leak. Room 510 was junior suite, which has a separate sitting area. It was big and very comfortable EXCEPT bathroom... The shower looks like a capsule (see picture) and is very small. It's hard not to bumping my arms while showering. Also it makes noises at night. I just didn't know what this is about... Overall, good location, service, and value. Reception staff was nice and very helpful. I asked her where the nearest post office is, and she offered to mail them for me if I just paid for the stamps. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located gem with character and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: kaibab1
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance from Puerta del Sol, Plaza Callao, the Royal Theatre, the Prado and other major attractions, this hotel is a standout for those preferring to lodge other than in the homogenized properties of global chains. Formerly a US diplomatic building, it has been restored and updated with care and taste. We had a large room with soundproofed French doors and a balcony facing the Plaza de las Descalzas Reales. (We can't vouch for rooms in other parts of the building). It had excellent bathroom fixtures, firm beds and high count linens. Also: a flat screen Sony digital TV with remote and internet (ADSL) connection. Plus: a generous breakfast buffet serving more-than-enough sweet and savory foods, incl. fresh fruit, cereals, croissants, rolls, breads, ham, sausage, cheeses, etc., etc. You will not find here a platoon of hovering staff but a compact team that cheerfully delivers attentive service. If you're looking for a refined and quiet place to stay, close to all main attractions and fairly priced, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in great location for walking - near Plaza Mayor etc.”
Reviews.Author: ShanVancouver_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it very comfortable, with good service and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Best for its central location within walking distance of major attractions.”
Reviews.Author: seruga
Reviews.Content: Average sized rooms overlooking Plaza San Martin which is rather noisy with traffic at night. This is fine at night if you keep the windows closed and have the AC on. Very comfortable firm beds. Very powerful shower over the bath. Fast hairdryer in bathroom. We had no problem at all with the internet connection in our room on the third floor. Rooms getting a little tired. The only disappointment was the extremely hot breakfast room on the sixth floor and their inability to cope with large numbers of guests for breakfast on Saturday morning which led to utter chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stef1234
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Palacio San Martin. The rooms were spacious compared to other European hotels we have stayed in. Our room was super quiet, even though our window looked out to a square that was very busy and noisy in the evening. The hotel has put in a double wall structure that blocks out all the late night noise. Location was excellent and it was very near the old town, Plaza Mayor and the Gran Via. Print a detail map of the location to give to the taxi driver. It's a bit difficult for them to find. One note - this is a beautifully renovated old hotel and we loved it, BUT if you like a more contemporary decor, this might not be the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: willy b
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel in a great city. the location is ideal, in the center of the historical city. All places are in easy reaching. Well maintained hotel with very good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, Friendly staff, Nice breakfast, Rooms and Internet access need improvement.”
Reviews.Author: flmiami
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times so far, and I plan to go back, and I recommend it for business travelers (with some caveats), for tourists, couples, solo travelers. I can not speak for families with kids or people with dissabilities. PLUSES GREAT LOCATION Right in Plaza San Martin in Madrid's downtown. A few steps away from Calle Arenal, Callao metro station, movie theaters, Gran Vía, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Corte Ingle, shops, bars, restaurants, etc. FRIENDLY STAFF Front desk personnel are very friendly and responsive both in person and by phone GREAT VALUE Nowadays is a great value, and the breakfast and the internet access are included in the daily rate. GREAT BREAKFAST Great selection and quality. Nice looking restaurant in the top floor overlooking Madrid's rooftops. BEAUTIFUL BUILDING, LOBBY, BAR AREA, STAIRS, HALWAYS This hotel is in a charming Madrid building, built long time ago, and it has certain charm (Old US Embassy). While the front desk is small, and there's only a small office behind it for their personnel and that may give a first time guest a "not so good" first impression (as it happened to me), once you go past the front desk, and into the bar area is homey and charming indeed, with friendly staff at the bar. The stairs and the old Madrid elevator are very beautiful, The hallways are nicely decorated, well lit, and quiet, with a nice carpet in very good shape (at least in the second floor, where I just stayed). AVAILABILITY OF QUIET ROOMS (facing internal Courtyard) I stayed in room 206 which faces an internal courtyard, and it was very quiet. Perfect! This is particularly attractive (for me) because this hotel is in a very busy area, and it can be noisy outside due to vehicles, pedestrians, and all the people coming out of bars singing and talking loudly at night, specially on Saturdays. I know so, because I have also stayed for many days in a nice hotel next to this one... The Roomate Laura, which I also recommend, but with the caveat that there are no internal rooms there, and the windows and doors were not soundproofed at the time when I was there (Sep to Dec 2008). See my review of such hotel here in TripAdvisor also. So, I now choose this hotel over the Roomate Laura in good part for such reason. (It's also a better value now. It used to be the opposite in 2008). NICELY DECORATED AND SPACIOUS BATHROOMS WITH GREAT SHOWER Beautiful. Well lit and with plenty of hot water at high pressure, and with shower controls that are easy to figure out and operate. Beats the much pricier Grand Meliá Fenix where I also stayed recently which has dark showers with low pressure only, and one of those modern Grohe shower controls which take a while to figure out how to operate. VERY GOOD AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM Adjustable with temperature settings marked on the dial, easy to operate, quiet and effective operation. It also beats the Grand Melia Fenix, which while it's also quiet and effective, it's not easy to operate as it does not have temperature settings marked in its dial, and has a second on/off switch in a different part of the room (next to the bed) which required me to call the Service Desk to know of its existance. INTERNET ACCESS (WI FI) INCLUDED IN THE DAILY RATE This is one of the issues that I am sensitive about, even when I normally travel for business and the company pays for all my expenses. They way I look at it, nowadays hotels should offer the internet access at no extra charge, just like the water coming out of the pipes, and the lights, and the A/C in the room. IMO, if they charge for it, the daily fee should be reasonable. Let's say that I pay USD 50.00 per month at home (in Miami, Florida, USA) for a DSL line (6 MB download / 512 kB upload speed). A hotel that charged USD 5.00 per day, would not make me blink, but often enough those hotels that charge for it, have exhorbitant fees USD 15, or 20, 25, 27, 30 per day. Well, when I stayed in this hotel the first time in 2008, they used to charge 17 EUROS per day for the internet access. Now they offer it at No Extra Charge... Congratulations and THANKS for such decision. On the not-so-good side, at the present time it is only available via WiFi in the lobby area, but according to the front desk staff, they are in the process of installing the equipment that would make it available in the rooms sometime in the fall of 2009. BRAND NEW FLAT PANEL TV (room 206) There was a brand new SONY BRAVIA flat pannel TV, possibly 27 inches or so on top of the desk. Some travelers might appreciate this. For me, that is not a factor because I normally do not watch TV in the hotels, and much less if I am staying in Madrid's downtown. I'd rather be outside enjoying what this city has to offer. Of course, it's a "nice to have" feature for a "rainy day". NOT PLUSES (BUT NOT NECESSARILY MINUSES) ROOM SIZE (206) This room is relatively small, and the desk, and chair are too close to the bed. I have seen other rooms of the same category and price, and they have different sizes and/or configurations, so it's a matter of either being lucky or asking the front desk for another room if the one assigned to you initially is not to your liking (depending on availability of course). On the plus side, since this room is in the second floor, and faces the courtyard on top of the lobby/bar, it is possible to catch the WiFi signal from the lobby. The signal strength was not high and sometimes it faded away and I got disconnected, but it worked most of the time. This should not be an issue in the future once they install the WiFi equipment in each of the floors. ROOM DECORATION (206) SO-SO There is a contrast between the nice look of the hallways which are also very well lit, and the not-so-nice look of the rooms, which are not-so-well lit either. The desk, night stands, and the bed look like they have been there for decades. However, considering how good value this hotel is, I am just mentioning this here as a potential improvement, and not as a complaint or criticism. However, if the hotel management decides to renovate the rooms eventually and make them look and feel consistently with the nice hallways, that would be VERY welcome. FINAL COMMENTS ABOUT THE HOTEL Thanks for reading this review, and if you travel to Madrid, you may want to give this hotel a try, and come back and post your comments here. COMMENTS ABOUT TRIPADVISOR.COM I have to say that TripAdvisor is a great resource for me. I travel extensively to many countries in Europe, Middle East and Africa for business, and I have found real gems thanks to the input of other travelers, so it feels good to be able to return the favor and contribute here. I have found that in general, while the priciest hotels (5 stars and top 4 stars) are a safe bet, in some cases, they have their shortmings (from minor to major) and that often enough there are better options and better values "next door" and thanks to TripAdvisor's travelers input, it's easy to make an informed decision and have a better travel experience. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: oregon64
Reviews.Content: The Palacio San Martin was just special. It is located within easy walking distance to Plaza Mayor, shopping, numerous tapa bars, historical sites and the major art museums including the Thysson, Prado and the Reina Sophia. The hotel is elegant and the staff helpful, welcoming and warm. It has free internet and WifFi access. We had brought along a new I-Touch but couldn't get it to link to the Wifi. The staff worked with us for at least 30 to 45 minutes attempting to make the link. Although we weren't able to make it work, we really appreciated the staff's diligence in trying. The breakfast at the hotel was great. It's on the top floor overlooking the city. I have to say that I'd like to know what brand of coffee they used. It had to be one of the finest in the city. We were able to find nearby bookstores. The staff helped arrange an excursion tour to the Excorial and the Valley of the Fallen that began within easy walking distance of the hotel. They recommended several nearby restaurants for menu de dia. The rooms are well kept and I would love to come back to the Intur some day. Just a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Whereisbob
Reviews.Content: First time in Madrid & stayed here for a week - take the breakfast deal - its vvery good. Close walking to the Plaza de Mayor and the de Moro Palace which are active & safe at night. Good restrauants and shops all around. Take the lower floor to get the best in-room internet reception. Hotel & room was very clean & quiet. Staffed is helpful well. Had saw poor rating in the past but they really fixed them. No surprises on the final bill either.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet historic building in the old city”
Reviews.Author: Baltimore_MDDuck
Reviews.Content: This restoratioin of the former U.S. Embassy succeeds on every level--the hotel has a cozy feel without sacrificing the amenities of a larger building. Most of the rooms face a courtyard, which eliminates street noise. The location is ideal--just steps away from Plaza Mayor, Plaza Santa Ana and connections to points beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, old style hotel on a lovely square in old Madrid, near everything”
Reviews.Author: Kelbridge
Reviews.Content: Just spent 11 days at this hotel--room was spacious and overlooked the square with a big window and small balcony but large enough to sit on and view the city. The only computer wireless available is in the pretty, comfortable lobby with a small bar. Sometimes we had to wait our turn at the computer--they should really get more than one. Hotel was quiet, desk staff were kind and helpful and spoke enough English to communicate our needs. Our daughter joined us for two nights and they moved a cot into our room at no extra charge for her. They quickly arranged taxi service when we needed it but could not tell us where to find a laundrymat. (Hotel laundry was excessively expensive). The square in front of the hotel was in need of cleaning and attention despite the prescence of a summer cafe. Homeless people slept on the grates every night and were always present in the morning and urinated openly in the grassy areas in clear view of the cafe and hotel. This did not particularly bother us since they did not approach us and there are homeless everywhere in Madrid and Europe especially in the hot summer. We loved the location of the hotel--we walked everwhere in Madrid and took the metro from Sol or Grand Via if we had to without problem. The cafes around the corner and down the back from the hotel are more "authentic", generous and cheaper--alwasy offering tapa and large drinks. Stay away from the food establishments in and around Plaza Mayor--they are touristy, expensive and unsanitary--had terrible paella there. Go further afield and have a better experience. Also, the Madrid bus tour is very good for orienting you to the city before starting out on foot. The tours run by the Julia Company in Plaza Espagna are very good as well, comfortable and clean with both English and Spanish speaking guides. Cafe con leche,queso bocadillas, and tortilla espangnola fabulous everywhere. Don't miss the camp de mayo overlook and cafe for a view of the Almudena catherdral and wonderful food. Would we stay here again--absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh air and daylight would have been nice”
Reviews.Author: Briercliffe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intur Palacio San Martin last weekend, for four nights with two friends. Our stay didn't start off too well.... Any form of greeting on arrival at the hotel was non existent, in fact the receptionist, who was on the phone when we walked in, didn't even acknowledge us or even look at us while we waited to be checked in. Nor did he apologise, welcome us or make any friendly conversation. Then came the rooms we were allocated (how I wished I'd insisted on changing room before I unpacked - although it was 9pm and we were starving and quite tired I suppose). We were given rooms 316 and 317 which overlook that dreaded lightwell. Whoever designed the refurbishment of the hotel and covered over the lightwell should be shot! On opening our french doors we were hit with warm stagnant air, so we ended up keeping them permanently closed and using the AC (which just dries out your eyes and mouth!). Plus, the room was very dark and we had to permanently have the lights on, which weren't that bright either. I like fresh air and to be able to see daylight, and what the weather's doing. I could only do that when in the breakfast room each morning. The main atrium lounge area isn't much better: brighter but still a bit stagnant. The main hotel toilets have no venitlation either, and are damp - nice! After spending four days feeling 'couped up' I really wished I'd swapped on arrival. This problem annoyed me more and more as time went on. The room: apart from being dark and badly ventilated, was fairly spacious and well appointed. Comfortable bed and good shower. We nearly gagged one evening on returning to our room after the maid had used the most foul smelling bleach I've ever known - it took hours for the smell to go! My first shower, on the Thursday night, saw me unravelling a bath towel that had a stain on it that looked like old blood! The towel was promptly changed but I did check each clean towel after that. The breakfast: great selection of tasty food and drinks on offer, awful service particularly on the saturday and sunday mornings (one good waitress and a gormless boy waiter - we cleared and laid our own table on the Saturday after waiting for so long!) and only one tea/coffee station; a Nespresso machine. It became funny after a while, watching the queue of half asleep guests trying to fathom out how it worked, then realising that it had run out of water/had a fault/was full of waste pods!!! The coffee it produced was nice, but for heavens sake BUY A SECOND ONE.... they can't be that expensive!!! Oh, by the way, the hotel has a small gym and a sauna (we weren't aware). Both work and are useful for a quick workout. The gym has 5 pieces of equipment and is well maintained. It also has a fridge stocked full of complimentary bottled water - tip! The location was absolutely brilliant, and we didn't spot one homeless person or drunk in the four days we were there. The square isn't as ugly as suggested in previous reviews and its really well located for pretty much everywhere: 10/15 minutes easy stroll to the palace, cathedral, Plaza Major and Prado. Shopping district on your doorstep, masses of bars and restaurants within 5-10 minutes, it couldn't have been better. Thinking back, we did sleep soundly every night! The quiet lightwell did have its benefits I suppose!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in a good location-but the bells:(”
Reviews.Author: garfield2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Madrid for a combination pleasure/business trip. the room was fine (except for the church bells that chime at 6:30 AM each day). There are some unsavory looking types that bunk in the square in front of the hotel. They were asleep when we returned in the evening and gone by the time we went out in the AM. They were of no bother to us or anyone that we could see. The breakfast in the picturesque dining room on the 6th floor was quite nice for 9 euro. The staff was quite helpful and did speak English relatively well. Great location for walking to the sites. Cabbies, however ,are unfamilar with where it is so be sure to carry the address with you. This being our first trip to Madrid we would have preferred a hotel with a concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: girasol01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel when in Madrid each of the past six years and have not been disappointed yet. If you want a trendy or just typically American hotel with lots of extras, look elsewhere. But if you can appreciate an elegant hotel that's slightly faded but spot on in terms of service, value and location, this is a good option. The rooms are large (by European standards) with high ceilings, modern bathrooms, comfortable beds. Some of the rooms do face the interior court so, if you're like me and prefer fresh air and sunlight in the morning, ask for a room on a higher floor facing the plaza. The plaza may not be the prettiest, but I'm a solo female traveler and have never had any problem there. In fact, the only problem I've ever had with the plaza is directing taxi drivers there, no one seems to know it by the name of Plaza San Martin. Tell your driver to go to Plaza de las Descalzas, same place, more familiar location. The hotel's in close proximity to Puerta del Sol, the Callao metro station is up the block, shopping and restaurants are all around, and you can easily get from here to any site you'd want to visit. I've always been very comfortable at this hotel and will definitely return next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel at the heart of madrid”
Reviews.Author: greekvet
Reviews.Content: I spend at this hotel 3 nights during easter it was a lovely hotel with friendly staff and always someone that spoke English. The rooms where big and the bathroom even bigger. Clean and tidy everyday. Being on the center everything is on walking distance. Great value for money (270 pounds for 3 nights during easter sounds a good deal to me) Reading the other reviews about the homeless people yes there were there but every big city has these. I never felt scared it was very safe area even when coming back late. Since i didnt have breakfast included i cannot have an opinion about that

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Chicag0Visit0r
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel that was nothing special, but for 85 Euros a night it was a great deal. The room was small but had a very nice bathroom and a large balcony. The location was great ,although it was on the worst square in Madrid. The main metro station in Madrid was a 5 minute walk away and there were a lot of good places to eat within 2 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Steerpike58
Reviews.Content: Staying in a major city is always a bit more of a challenge; the prices are higher and the amenities lower, compared to smaller towns. I can't fault our room - everything worked and it was very quiet - but the location was a slight disappointment. The square was perhaps the ugliest square in Madrid, with lots of weird 'portable' metal 'stalls' in it, where various products were being sold. Again, nothing terribly wrong, just not great either. The overall location was not bad - quick walk to the Opera, and the busy shopping areas. We arrived by taxi from Atoche, but took the metro to the airport when leaving - the taxi took forever in the thick traffic, while the metro was a breeze. There was a charge for internet access (which I refuse to pay), but did have a free PC in the lobby. Breakfast was on the top floor; mostly good, and hot items were cooked to order, but the coffee was a disappointment after staying in other hotels where the coffee was espresso pulled to order. I only drink coffee and have one pastry, so I'd prefer the better coffee and no hot stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...will stay here again definitely”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of our favorites! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful; the rooms were immaculate; the location was perfect, with sites at your footsteps. Let me add that I am not easily impressed, but this hotel really did impress me. As for the reviews that there are homeless people outside, there was not even a single one in the vicinity. We did see a security guard outside on saturday night, so that could be why. Anyways, we stay at plenty of hotels, as we travel quite a bit, and this hotel was a pleasant surprise. The room was facing the courtyard and was a tiny bit dark, but we got a great breeze at night and it was dead silent (so for me its worth the trade off). The staff was friendly and very helpful with everything. p.s.. I found out from a book that the hotel actually used to be a US embassy which was converted into a hotel. Pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jacqueet
Reviews.Content: We arrived straight from the plane from the U.S. and were pleased to find that our room was ready at 10 A.M.! The staff was quite nice and accommodating but the room was so small we had to stash some bags under the bed and only one of us could move around the room at one time. The room overlooked the plaza but because of the addition of an extra set of doors, was VERY quiet, in spite of the homeless men who gathered below and played music until very late. The hotel is clean and very centrally located to the Plaza Major, the subway and many wonderful tapas bars. My husband and I both agreed that we would stay there again in spite of the size of the room because of the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sassIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - merealy a 2 minute stroll to the hustle and bustle of the streets of Madrid. The hotel is about a 20-25 minute taxi drive from the airport but it gives you time to take in the sights. The hotel itself was old-worldy. Everything was spotless and very comfortable. We had a balcony in our room, which you can request on booking, and we found this great for those balmy summer evenings. Madrid itself is spectacular and definitely a city worth seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & blissfully quiet”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed 3 nights in this quiet, clean , very centrally located hotel. Good sized room, fabulous breakfast. Helpful staff. The vagrants to the right were a bit off putting but never hassled us- and there were beggars across Madrid but we didnt find them pushy. The ' pied piper' played his tunes a bit at teatime but importantly the evenings were really really quiet which was good for us as light sleepers. The main shops including El Cortes Ingles are about 200 metres away- shopping heaven. Recommend Floor 9 window seat for lunch- waiter service menu of the day about 15 euro.The Prado etc is about a 15/20 minute walk- go early to avoid queues. We also went to the Bernabeu by Metro

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not a great hotel really”
Reviews.Author: Maz945
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over new year. Location is very good indeed, but the rooms leave a little to be desired. In my room the roomsafe didn't work, nor did the pay TV. Also, on 30 December at around 12.30 midnight, Reception phoned me 3 times telling me the Doctor (?) had turned up for me, and then came to the room at 1am with the Doctor in tow! The room I was in was small and looked in on the courtyard which is totally enclosed, so opening the window for fresh air a waste of time. The bathroom was ok, with good water pressure and very hot and very cold water. Perhaps try to get a room with a view! Breakfast on the 6th floor was pretty good, but no other restaurant in the hotel which is strange for a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bmac59
Reviews.Content: great central location for a very nice hotel. We found vagrants sleeping outside the hotel and in the open area opposite but did not think it was any worse than the other areas we visited in Madrid, and all I can say is the Madrellanas have a very relaxed attitude to them and I found them non threatening. I stayed with my husband on a room only basis as there are plenty of places to find breakfast. The room was clean and there were a variety of complimentary products in the bathroom, and reception seemed to be able to provide me with a further variety of things eg emery board,plasters. The hotel is interesting as it retains some of its charm and is more individual than a lot of chain hotels. Our room was slightly dark,but looked out onto a courtyard so we just opened the curtains and left the nets closed to make it lighter. The only small point was that when other rooms used their bathrooms you could here the water draining away but I am quite a light sleeper and it didn't bother my husband. The room was cleaned daily and we found the staff helpful. If you are looking for a central location, I don't think you could beat this as it is 5 minutes walk to the palacio real and 10 minutes to Plaza Major. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Impressions”
Reviews.Author: demlad
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here at the beginning of our Spain trip. Taxi driver could only get us close. We had to walk a ways and ask for directions, then cross over some less than attractive front entry with homeless and dog poop. But we stayed upbeat...until they were unable to get us a room due to water damage. But they found us another hotel, honored their price to us and the hotel paid the difference at the new hotel. In the end we were happy with our new place and preferred the other, cleaner location. I don't know if our impression would have been better if we had stayed here or not, but our first impression did not match up to others reviews of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DLODRATSAB
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed in this lovely hotel for 5 nights from 4th October .It is centrally placed only a few minutes walk from the centre of the city in a quiet plaza . Check-in was a breeze and the room on the 5th floor had a balcony with a good view over the city .The room was to a very high standard with air-con ,a great shower and a very comfortable bed .The room was very clean and kept to a very high standard throughout our stay .The buffet breakfast was outstanding with every sort of cold meats ,cheese ,pastries and fresh fruit you could want with eggs ,bacon etc available on request. The hotel has an old world charm and is ideal as a base to visit this most beautiful city .Also in the plaza is a bar called The Urban Cafe ,very modern and they mix a mean cocktail .There are many fine restuarants within a few minutes walk but one I would highly recommend is Sobrino De Botin ,the oldest in the world ( 1725 ) .It appears in all the guide books and unlike so many tourist attractions the food will not disappoint ,the speciality , the suckling pig is outstanding .Reservations a few days in advance essential. Getting from Madrid airport is a 15 min taxi ride at about 25-30 euros .There is nothing about this hotel not to like ,highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DuchessF
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. it's located in a very good and calm area, walking distance to many places of interest. It's considered as a 4* hotel, not 3 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on the ground floor”
Reviews.Author: Torroxtim
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is centrally located and is good for most amenities however, it is in the scruffier part of Madrid and you need to be aware that homeless/beggers in the small square outside and the area generally. ( Also pick pockets 'track' you in Gran Via) Avoid being allocated a ground floor room at this Hotel as they are actually below ground level and have 'false' windows. I also would not rate it as a 4 star Hotel, although its not bad for a 2+.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: soraya-marc
Reviews.Content: This is a very good choice in Madrid: clean, centric location in a quiet area. Make sure you ask for a room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location on a quiet square”
Reviews.Author: TomChatt
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel -- just a few blocks to the Palace, to Sol, or to Gran Via -- could not be better for walking around the heart of Madrid. And yet despite being in the center of this late-night city, this hotel is on a quiet square next to a convent. (My husband can't sleep if it's not quiet, and he slept well here.) The room was modern, and had all the quality you'd expect at something like a Marriott. Reasonable size room, and bathroom to American standards. Breakfast was a very nice full-featured hot and cold buffet, served on the 7th floor with a nice view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: plant-travellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after reading lots of reviews from other travellers. It is in a great central location within easy walking distance of many of the main sights,but is away from the noisy streets. We requested a room overlooking the Plaza as recommended by other reviewers. We were given room 509 which was on the 5th floor overlooking the Plaza. It is a large room with a sitting area, double bed and balcony. It is very comfortable and nice and quiet. We did see the homeless people outside the hotel but they didnt bother us, though I can see why some people on the other side of the hotel on lower floors would be annoyed by their music making. We booked transfers from the airport in advance on aerocity.com which was 17 euros for both of us and felt this was good value.We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. Found some great bars and Tapas in the old Latina area . The staff were pleasant. We would stay in this hotel again,would recommend that you request a room overlooking the Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zuson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at Intur Palacio San Martin and are convinced that this has been the perfect choice for us. Thanks to all the other reviews, we have choosen this hotel mainly for being located at a quiet square in the heart of Madrid. And it turned out to be true. We had room No. 409, the best room in the hotel, like they say. Its a corner room on top of the buliding with two small balconies and good views onto the plaza, the convent and beyond. The room was very nice with a very big bed (its actually two single beds being put together), nice classic decoration, minibar, tv, aircondition but no coffee making facilities. Big bathromm with a very good and strong shower and pidet, if needed. As the plaza is quiet we strongly recommend to take a room facing the plaza. Moreover the balcony doors are doubled up and if closed you dont hear anything. The hotel itself looks very nice, is in perfect order and the old elevator is a nice feature (there is a new one as well). Staff was friendly, but english was a problem for some of them. The location of the hotel is a big plus. It is in between Gran Via and Puerta del Sol and near the Plaza Major. Everything is in walking distance. We really enjoyed our stay in Madrid and in this hotel and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, but too bad about the noisy, homeless vagrants!”
Reviews.Author: Trip Advisor from Dallas, TX
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week to Spain, Portugal & Morocco which included a 2 nite stay at the Intur Palacio San Martin. We had 2 very nice, clean rooms facing the plaza. The little square is very quiet & traffic free but the lovely ambience is negatively impacted by the large group of homeless vagrants which have taken up residence outside the hotel. We were not bothered by the presence of the homeless group as we were coming & going from the hotel during the middle of the day. However, we were very much disturbed by the loud instruments, clapping, shouting and barking of the many dogs which accompanied the homeless group. This "performance" began in early afternoon & continued late into the night making it difficult to take afternoon rests or sleep in the evening. There is some type of venting system that is in the middle of the square in front of the hotel which the homeless people use to sleep on top of. When you leave the hotel in the morning, the area is covered with the homeless group's sleeping blankets, etc. It is a shame that this is occuring outside the hotel as the hotel is very lovely & in a wonderful location for sightseeing in Madrid. The Plaza Mayor is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel & as stated in other reviews, is a lovely square. The concierge was very helpful with taxis, etc. If I were making a choice of where to stay in Madrid, I would not stay at this hotel until the presence of the homeless people outside of the hotel is relocated to another location. If you read previous reviews of this hotel, other reviewers have made similar comments about the vagrant's presence.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kimbermls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of May on the last leg of our two-week trip around Spain. It's in a fantastic location, easy walking distance to the Royal Palace, Plaza de Espana, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, & all the museums. Yes, there are some homeless people that hang around, but they never once bothered us (2 single women). We had a great corner room on the 2nd floor that faced the plaza. Nice size & nice amenities. We did opt for the overpriced breakfast one day, simply because I was craving something besides carbs! There really are better options in the morning located nearby, including the Spanish version of Starbucks, Pans & Co. (or a real Starbucks right down the street). For a fabulous dinner, walk around the block to Calle Navas de Tolosa. There you will find the wonderful Restaurante Cornucopia [--], run by an ex-pat American and her two partners. We had a fantastic meal and shared chipitas and stories with Kim before heading off to a flamenco show. Our only problem with the hotel was that they charged us for eating breakfast twice, the 2nd time on the morning we checked out. In the rush to catch our cab, I did not notice until I looked at our bill on the plane. However, I emailed them, and they willingly refunded the extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location in a Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GOMCP
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel – very convenient for the centre of Madrid. The down-side is that Taxi Drivers do not know where it is - you have to ask for Descalzas. Excellent breakfast – lots of fresh fruit, pastries etc and you can order hot food. The only minor complaint we had was that on one day the room had not been made-up by the time we returned at 3pm. This was quickly resolved with no fuss and we had complimentary coffee and pastries while we waited (just 20 minutes). The room was clean and well maintained. We had a room overlooking the court-yard so it was a bit on the dark side, but this is a problem in many hotels – why don’t they have a main light in the middle of the room? There were some vagrants on one side of the hotel – but these were harmless and no problem at all. The Monastery adjacent to the hotel is well worth a visit – you can only go round in a guided group. We are not sure if there are any English-speaking guides, but we had to go round with a Spanish guide – even so it is very impressive with so much art to see.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: atty_busnss_travlr
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 night at this hotel, and enjoyed it very much. We started with a room overlooking an airshaft, which was quite dark, so moved to a room overlooking the side street above a sidewalk cafe and a group of 5 to 15 homeless guys mostly in their 20s acting like jerks with their radios, flutes, dogs and drunken banter. This group lived (and I assume lives still) in the area between the hotel's front door and this side street, aka under our window. This was mostly a problem at night, but the double paned windows completely shut out the noise. The problem was that the air conditioner wasn't up to keeping the sealed room at a comfortable temperature. Both of us would awake during the night to a hot and airless room. My recommendation is to ask for a room on the plaza, at the front of the hotel (but not on the end with the homeless). The room itself was above average size for a 3 star European hotel, with a large bathtub/shower in a well appointed bathroom. The room had comfortable chairs and decent reading lights. There are only 2 elevators, and thus the wait can be excessive during busy times, but most of the time it wasn't an issue. There is a very nice sitting area on the ground floor where drinks are served, and daily newspapers are available in several languages. This area is light and airy, and was the only public area that we ever used in our recent stay at 6 hotels in Spain. There is overpriced internet access from one computer in the common area. The hotel staff, from front desk to bar attendant to cleaning crew was consistently professional, helpful and pleasant. Probably most tourists stay in the area around the Prado. This hotel is not in that area, though the Prado is reached with a pleasant 20-25 minute walk. This hotel is in the area near the Grand Via and near the palace. There are more restaurants, shops and street activity in the area where this hotel is located, though the hotel itself is on a very quiet plaza. We much preferred this area to that of the Prado for the proximity of a large selection of things to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsDreamer
Reviews.Content: Converted palace in very nice square next to the Convent of Descalzes in the centre of Madrid but quiet with excellent double glazing. Need to have a room looking onto the squarewith balcony. although these are smaller than dark side roms or those looking onto internal atrium. Excellent air conditioning and modern bathrooms with shower and bath. Wonderful buffet breakfast on 6th floor with lovely view of roof tops of Madrid. Do not recommend eating in hotel for lunch or dinner as menu small and limited. Staff variable in helpfulness and graciousness. Nice central atrium for drinks or snacks. We stayed 4 nights and would recommend for visiting Madrid and almost everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Swifty79
Reviews.Content: Hello, Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Intur Palacio San Martin and it was a good little hotel. The location is great - very close to Plaza Mayor, Gran Via and Puerto Del Sol. The rooms were really clean and the staff were very helpful. When we first arrived we were put in room 406 - this had a double bed and was on the inside of the building - this meant that there was no access to fresh air as the terrace it overlooks is enclosed - the room was quite stuffy - we asked to move and were moved the following day to room 410 which had a view of the Plaza de San Martin and lovely fresh air - it was also a lot bigger - our advice is to ask for a room with a view and not for a double room as all of those are on the inside. Other than that the hotel was great and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Criefftraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Palacio San Martin in Madrid at the end of March. The location of the Hotel is excellent all main attractions are within easy walking distance. Shops on the Gran Via are also very close at hand and El Corte Ingles is next to the hotel. Art exhibitions and museums are also in the Plaza San Martin. Rooms are spacious, clean and well presented. The bathroom is also nice but with a powerful shower which caused a bit of a flood. Take care. Hotel staff very helpful and polite. we did not eat breakfast in the hotel, €15 a bit expensive as you can find many lovely cafes near the hotel. Valor is just around the corner and the wonderful Cafe Oriente a 5 minute walk away. As mentioned in other reviews the one off putting thing is the beggars/homeless who seem to congregate outside the hotel; that said they did not pester us only made us a little wary. There were quite a few roadworks taking place near the hotel but in calle Arenal they were almost finished obviously the pressure was on to complete by the Easter holiday . It was quite amusing to see huge construction/building activity at midnight as we returned to the hotel from the Opera,next morning the roadworks were all but finihed and they were planting blossom trees!! There are also major building works taking place in the Plaza San Domingo which is close by and I am sure this will have a disruptive effect on the Tryp Ambassador Hotel. All in all a very good trip and a certain return to the Palacio San Martin, if only for the superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but very sedate”
Reviews.Author: KJB77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week and had a good time. The rooms were a decent size and were spotless. The walls are a bit on the thin side - we could hear our neighbour snoring! It was however a bit on the boring side, we came home from dinner one evening and the hotel bar was closed at 11.15pm and this is Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SKEArizona
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel and location. It was nice to be able to step off the busy streets into this quiet square. Once they finish the street construction, this square is going to be very pretty. What I loved was how easy it was to walk to many of the key sights including Plaza Mayor and the area just south of the plaza which has numerous great restaurants and tapas bars (we spent several nights wandering this area). The hotel itself is an excellent hotel, the room was good and everything was very quiet. I wouldn’t hesitate to return. Yea, like everyone says- the bummer is that within 15 yards from the hotel entrance a handful of homeless have staked their territory. It was a little unnerving when we first pulled up and I wondered what I had gotten into. However, they didn’t give us any trouble and I viewed it as just another valuable life experience for my teenage daughter. Try the restaurant just around the corner of the hotel that they recommend. Fabulous special rice and seafood dishes. Great meal and so close.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: 57-yr_old_couple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Intur Palacio San Martin on March 1-3, 2007. When we asked for a double bed, rather than two twins, we received a very-average room with absolutely no view. I then asked if they wouldn't have something with a better view. I was told we could have a room overlookng the square, but that it would have two twin beds, although they would be pushed side-by-side. (Incidentally this seems to be a common arrangement in Spanish hotels.) We requested that room and it was wonderful with a fantastic view. The hotel is nice and quiet as San Martin square is not one of the popular attractions like Plaza Mayor. However it is only 2-3 blocks to the left of the hotel entrance to the Puerta del Sol and the El Corte Ingles department store, maybe 4-5 blocks straight ahead to Plaza Mayor, and about 5-6 blocks to the right to the Palacio Real. When we stayed at the hotel, there was a free temporary display of paintings and art from the Thyssen-Bornemiza Museum in the building directly across the square from the hotel. There is also a Metro (subway) station to the left of the hotel. The only possible negative aspect to the hotel is that several wino-types hang around the Metro entrance during most of the day and night.. However we never saw them hassle or panhandle anyone passing by. This is a great place to say in Madrid. We highly recommend it ; just don't insist on a double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal all on all fronts”
Reviews.Author: hardie
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights in early March; good comfortable well-furnished room, great location, fine building , helpful staff. Would go back happily.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Welshtraveller111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break at the Palacio San Martin in March 2007. The hotel is situated in an excellent location within walking distance of the main attractions. As the hotel is located on a Plaza, it was very quiet especially at night. As commented by the previous reviewers, there were some vagrants located outside the hotel. However, they were situated on the corner of the hotel, not directly outside the front door as previously advised. Walking past any homeless people (including these) is not a pleasant experience but you have to accept that there are homeless people in cities throughout the world. If it bothers you that much, you could generally avoid them by walking around them, rather than straight past. I did not feel threatened at any time. Now back to the hotel, the reception and the lounge is quite small but very pleasant. We were allocated a room on the 2nd floor which was quite large with a view of the Plaza. The bathroom was a bit small but more than adequate. The cleanliness of the hotel throughout was excellent. The staff were generally friendly and helpful but some only had a very basic knowledge of the English language. One receptionist totally mis-understood a simple request due to the language barrier. As commented previously, breakfast at the hotel is expensive. However, if this is not an issue the quality of the food and general atmosphere is very good. Breakfast is served on the top floor with panoramic views of the City. Also tried the evening meal at the hotel, once again a bit pricey but it you want something special it is definitely worthwhile. The hotel has recently introduced a three course set menu with a choice of courses for 25 euros per person, including wine and coffee. Recommend visiting the main attractions including the Royal Palace, Playa Mayor, Retro Park and the museums. There is also a temporary exhibition (until 20/05/07) “The Mirror & The Mask in the age of Picasso” directly opposite the hotel. If you are an EU Member, don’t forget to take a photocopy of your passport to the Royal Palace on Wednesday’s for a free entry. Entry to the “Monasterio de las Descalzas Reales” situated next door to the hotel is also free on Wednesday’s for EU citizens. A word of warning though, it is not possible to walk around the convent at your own pace, have to go on a tour. All of the tours are in Spanish and last approximately fifty minutes. Travelled by taxi from the airport to the hotel, approximately 30 euros during rush hour traffic. For the return journey, I recommend the mini bus transfer with aero city for 20 euros for two people. This is booked from the hotel reception. Enjoyed my stay in the Palacio San Martin, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “if you love homeless people outside the hotel”
Reviews.Author: alljoy
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at the Intur Palacio San Martin- the hotel was very pretty inside- different in decor from the other cities we were first in- a major problem however, were the homeless people and their dogs that hung out right outside the door of the hotel- it was not a comfortable feeling always seeing them there, day and night. It hindered our visit to Madrid, especially at night. Another complaint was that our room was not made up until about 3:00 in the afternoon so we were unable to take a little siesta when we came back from sightseeing. The room was not cleaned very well when it was finally done. i would not suggest anyone stay here until the homeless are gone- this is definately not a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beechmk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all: location, helpful staff, and value, a beacon among overpriced Madrid properties. El Convento de Reales Descalzes, which has some of the best religious art in Spain, inculding a dozen tapestries for which Ruebens drew the cartoons, is next door. The staff is qualified and helpful. The hotel is also near fine dining in and around the Plaza de Santa Ana. Our room was on the second floor (primera planta) and had real furniture and a comfortable bed. Best deal in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “good central Madrid location”
Reviews.Author: dreiBaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in room #503 which is a spacious room with two twin beds pushed together and an additional bed added for our child. There is a door out to a private balcony which has a great view of the city. The room was quiet and clean. The room includes a small sofa with coffee table, a writing desk, TV on a small cabinet, a luggage rack, TV amoire with drawers and closet with a safe. The bathroom has a bidet directly in front of the toilet and both are very close to the shower/tub entrance making it a bit difficult to step in & out of. Shower door is 1/3 covering which allows water to splash out onto toilet & floor (common in Europe). There is a hair dryer as well as small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc. Mattresses are a bit hard & sunken. The location of this hotel is about 3-4 blocks north of Puerta del Sol, center of the city. From here it is about a 20+ minute walk to the Prado museum. There is not a Metro line that goes to the museum neighborhood. We took the Metro from here to the central train station (Atocha) for the high speed train to Toledo (30 min) for one night and then returned (a great side trip). Get a good city map & walking is not a problem. Be careful on the Metro, we had our first pick-pocket in Europe experience, women who jammed themselves next to us in a Metro train with their coats over their roving arms. They tried to get my husband's wallet but he wears a vest with inside pockets and they were unsuccessful. They got a pack of tissues from me while distracting us by talking to our daughter. A lesson in being aware of those around you at all times! There is an elevator. The lobby is non-smoking! Front desk employees are helpful. On our arrival to airport we took a taxi to hotel & were charged 50 euros(ouch!) Then for our return to the airport we arranged an airport shuttle through the front desk for 20 euros for three of us. Perhaps they could arrange a pickup if you were to contact them in advance? The breakfast was not included in our price 115 euro/night. We were quoted 17 euro per person for breakfast. We didn't eat here but stopped at cafes we found near Puerta del Sol. There is a Starbucks a few blocks away, ask for directions. Overall, this hotel is a very good choice, we'd stay here again & recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Saking
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Intur Palacio during February for a romantic city break. The location of the hotel is excellent, situated in Old Madrid, and within walking distance to most of the interesting places including the Royal Palace which is a must to see. A taxi to the hotel from the airport will cost approximately 30 Euros. Around the hotel there are numerous restaurants, tapas bars, coffee shops and eateries all of which are easily accessible by foot. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite but not all could speak English. However, it wasn't difficult to get your point across using a variety of Spanish and English and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are of reasonable size with a nicely sized bathroom with the normal amenities. I am not sure if its a general rule throughout the hotel but the double bed was two singles pushed together. However, it was still comfortable and the area around the hotel was very quiet at night. The hotel does have it's own restaurant and bar with a continental breakfast buffet served within the restaurant. I booked the hotel directly through their website and the cost was quite reasonable for a 4-star hotel. However, it's worth noting that breakfast is not included when booking on-line. The only complaint we had during our stay was the lack of service at the bar. The bar area is situated near the lobby and after waiting for approximately 15 minutes, and after mentioning the lack of service to the reception, still nobody was around to serve us drinks. This resulted in us giving up! Overall the hotel was a pleasant surprise, very friendly staff and an excellent location. I would definitely stay there again should I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocation”
Reviews.Author: haystacks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intur Palacio for three nights over the 2007 New Year. We were lucky in getting one of the corner rooms with two balconies mentioned in previous reviews, although our friends had an adjacent room which was equally spacious. The hotel and the rooms were spotlessly clean, the king-size bed extremely comfortable. The reliability of the older lift was somewhat suspect, but other than that we have no complaints whatsoever. As long as the hotel is clean and comfortable the main thing for us is the location, and this hotel is just about perfect. Less than ten minutes walk to nearly all of the main sites (the exceptions being the Prado and Thyssen museums) and located in a quiet square only about 200m from the Metro, it would be very difficult to find anywhere better. Don't use the Metro to/from the airport if you are carrying anything heavier than hand luggage - although it's only €1 per trip you have to change twice and there are quite a lot of stairs to climb up and down. A taxi to return to the airport cost us just over €20 from Plaza del Callao. Just one final point about the hotel - we only had breakfast there once (New Years Day); everything was very good, very fresh, etc but at €18 per person it was also very expensive. You can eat just as well in any of the local bars for about €4 - €5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, Charm”
Reviews.Author: AmandaSBratislava
Reviews.Content: My only problem with this hotel was returning by taxis there. Three said they did not know the Plaza de San Martin. Hotel later told me to say "Descalzas." Not much help at 2:00 am in the rain. But room was huge, gorgeous, well stocked mini bar. Breakfast was included although I thought it was not. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Palacio San Martin”
Reviews.Author: romaboots
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palacio San Martin in Sept. 2003. Our room was large with a balcony overlooking the street and had lovely furnishings and a spacious bathroom. The location is very central for walking to the sites and museums in Madrid. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has all the modern comforts that one could desire yet the charm and historical decor has been retained. We highly recommend the Palacio San Martin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: SUMMAGOLD
Reviews.Content: November 9-11, 2006 Great location. Very central to everything. Just 2-3 blocks to Plaza Mayor, 2-3 blocks to Puerto del Sol, 10-12 short blocks (just less than 10 minute walk) to the Prado. Excellent! Amenties are excellent. Internet use in the lobby (for a small fee), clean big rooms, clean modern bathrooms, and great view from our room window. We would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rew01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a 2 night weekend break from the cold of Yorkshire in November. The location is central yet hidden away in a quiet square. Staff we extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was quite small but comfortable (we didn't spend alot of time there). The central courtyard was a great place to relax with a tour book and a cup of tea (with complimentary home made biscuits). We didn't eat breakfast there (it seemed a bit pricey) as there were lots of place to get a coffee and a bun in the neighborhood. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the central sites of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cricket6302
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing bad you could say about this hotel. The room was big, nice, clean, well-appointed. The decor wasn't super charming or unique, but was extremely comfortable and well-done. The location is a short walk to everything -- the Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via, the Opera and the Palace -- but is tucked back by a convent and is quiet at night. (We ended up on the first floor, which was a little annoying because a flautist parked himself directly beneath our window and would play the same tune for hours, but he'd leave by bedtime, so it wasn't a problem.) We did have trouble finding the place because our cab driver kept insisting there was no Plaza San Martin, where our map said the hotel was located. Mention the hotel is located right next to the Convent of Descalzas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, top hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ale_esteves
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice located near subway Callao. Puerta del Sol is walking distance from the hotel, as well as Gran Via. Hotel is located on a beautiful square, near a Convent called Descalzas (don't miss it) and near El Corte Ingles. There are some people "living" on the plaza, but they don't bother you and you don't need to be scared. Madrid has life and lots of people on the street until early hours in the morning. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, Starbucks as well as other bakerys are located in Callao, very near the hotel and are very cheap. Even in El Corte ingles the breakfast costs 1.80 euro for a hot drink and pastry. Don't try the red bus, very touristic and Madrid has traffic. The subway takes you everywhere and it costs 1 euro the ride or 9 euros for unlimited 3 days. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel San Martin was Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: sandytoes
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the San Martin for 5 nights in early Sept. We got a great price for the room on the internet and were not disappointed. After the first night, upon requesting a larger room, we were moved to the absolutely huge #314. The decor throughout the hotel was very attractive and the bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the balcony and view of the plaza. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was fabulous-close to everything, but fairly quiet. Definitely recommend going on a tour of the convent next door-fabulous art works. Also-the Supermarket @ the Corte Ingles has great takeout options if you feel like just having a small meal in the room. Our price didn't include breakfast, and we thought it was a bit pricey, so I can't comment on that aspect. When we return to Madrid, we'll definitely stay at the San Martin again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite during trip”
Reviews.Author: quoeratdemonstrandum
Reviews.Content: Out of the four hotels I stayed in during my visit to Spain, this was my favorite. It has a great location in a quiet plaza, yet still very central and walkable to many popular sights such as Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. It's also close to the El Corte Ingles department store and supermarket. The rooms as well as the lobby and common areas are very attractive with tasteful and classy decor. Got a cool antique elevator as well as a modern one. The room I had was unique in that it had a living area that was separated by a step. Regarding the staff, they were polite and nice, if on the reserved side. They responded quite quickly and helpfully after I got stuck in an elevator that stopped between floors however never really apologized which was a bit disappointing. Another unfortunate thing is that I asked two front desk people on two seperate occasions how to get to the neaby town of Chinchon. They were both helpful but unfortunately gave me incorrect information. But for the record, these did not sour my experience as they're probably isolated exceptions, not the rule. The only negative is that the shower/tub in our room is designed without a movable door or curtain so it's always partially open which can lead to a bit of splashing and leakage out into the rest of the bathroom. All in all though, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: johnnykluv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an interesting contrast in that the Plaza is cloistered (& next to a convent) yet within one block from a vibrant, fun area full of movie houses, tapeos, restaurants, bookstores, but all with a local feel. It is close to the Metro and you generally can flag down a cab. In the midst of the "shampoo crisis" of the airlines, the staff made calls to see what we could carry on and got us a taxi to pick us up at 4 AM. They were very friendly but I agree that they were somewhat vague, e.g., pointing you in the general direction but not giving addresses or specific recommendations. (And I speak Spanish). I spotted a couple of vagrants outside but being from NYC this is nothing special to me and I never felt threatened. I never heard the bells of the convent but I wouldn't deny the other reviewers' experiences. There is no computer service, but there is a cheap café about 5 blocks away. The room was average sized for Europe but comfortable and clean. The mattresses are every bit as hard as others have stated. The room safe is free to use. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming , quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: lnnj861
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. I stayed in the hotel for two weeks in July. This is a charming hotel in a great location, and an excellent value. The hotel is in the quiet Plaza San Martin and with the windows shut the only outside noise is the church bells from the convent - which added to the ambience. The first room was an interior room that would be fine for a short stay – but for two weeks I asked if I could wait for a room facing the Plaza and by the time I came back from lunch room 313 was ready. The room was a good size even by US standards and the rooms and public areas were always very clean. The bathrooms are stocked with a variety of toiletries. I had a great view of the plaza and a small balcony. The plaza is a quiet haven considering that it is a short walk to almost everywhere into the city. The hotel is next to the Convent and a block away from the department store Cortes Ingles. The store sells everything and has a large food supermarket in the basement. The other recommendation if you have never been to Madrid is to go to [""]and download the guide for Madrid. – it is way better than any book you will buy. Go up to the hotel restaurant – take a peek out the windows for the view but it did seem pricy - breakfast was 17 Euros - but there are so many other great options in the city . The staff was very helpful and service was exceptional the entire two weeks. I used Trip Advisor and then booked with Price line Europe and got the room for 77 Euros a night but it would have still been a great deal at more. It is a really charming hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Palacio San Martin -- great location and hospitality in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: DrStroke
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two separate occasions at Palacio San Martin in June 2006. We paid 143 euros/night (111 for room + 16 x 2 for breakfast) tax not included, through intur website. Other reviewers felt breakfast buffet overpriced, but I found price reasonable for a) quantity and quality of food and b) room price. For the first three nights we had a very nice room on the fourth floor overlooking the plaza. The plaza is very quiet, perhaps because of the convent (now a state site) next door. Upon return we were upgraded to a fifth floor suite, also overlooking the plaza. Tremendous value for money with very helpful front desk staff and great location. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bfitz
Reviews.Content: This is a very good boutique hotel which is very well located for business or tourism. Front of house staff are fluent in English and are most helpful. The high-ceiling rooms are comfortable and adequate, if not spacious. Try for a room overlooking the Square. These have opening French doors and a tiny balcony. As well as a modern elevator the hotel has a quaint old wire and steel relic which still works. Other rooms open onto a central atrium and may be stuffy in hot weather. A corner room (309,409 etc) is a bonus because it has doors and balcony to two sides. Many restaurants, bars, major stores, and small shops are close by (for example, try a little restaurant - El Ceccubucco- left out of the front doors and a few metres up the hill.) A good three course meal-of-the-day, including a half bottle of wine per person, was about 11 euros. A really good deal ! This hotel of some 90 rooms deserves its four stars and is well-recommended (despite two very stressed and not-friendly waiotresses who lorded overf the breakfast room, one of whom clomped around noisily on the wooden floor while not achieving a great deal. For our first visit to Madrid, the Palacio San Martin was a very good base indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: campus
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Intur Palacio San Martin in Madrid was a good experience until we had to deal with getting tickets to the bullfight. The man at the front desk said he would only help us get tickets if we paid for them in cash, something we didn't understand until later. He charged us $90 euros for $44 euro tickets and then refused to give us a refund. He said it was because the tickets were hard to obtain and he had to pay extra. At the bullfight there were only small number of people attending and the lady at the ticket booth said they were selling tickets for weeks and the sales were very slow. I had expected to pay a little more for the tickets since we went through the hotel, but charging more than twice the cost of the ticket is ridiculous. I realized that some members of the staff of this hotel are not to be trusted. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: FLB24
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel for Madrid visitors. Perfectly located in the old town in easy walking distance to most attractions - Grand Via, Palace, Prado etc. Good sized rooms. The front office staff were all reasonably proficient in English (a big plus for Spain) and helpful. Would definitely stay here again. The monastry next door was a real surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor we stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-May. Would stay here again in a minute and highly recommend it. Location is great only a few blocks from the Royal Palace, the Cathredal, Plaza Mayor, etc. Lots of restaurants in the area. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom were good-sized.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Madrid two or three times a year for business and have stayed in a variety of hotels. My fourth stay at the Palacio San Martín in January 2006 was just as satisfying as the first time I stayed there in 2004. Its location cannot be beat, the rooms are large, clean and beautifully furnished, and the staff is friendly and efficient. As other reviewers have mentioned, the plaza in front of the hotel does attract some characters but I have never felt the least bit unsafe. It is the only place I will stay in Madrid. Other hotels pale in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: wired2theworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Intur Palacio San Martin in October 2005 for two nights. The Hotel sits right on the Plaza San Martin, about 3 blocks from the Puerta Del Sol and is nicely located for walking all over central Madrid. I'd asked for a room with a view of the plaza, but unfortunately, all the rooms were completely full and none with view were available when we arrived. The front desk staff were not overly helpful, but did say we could move the next day if something opened up. Our room was small, but average by European standards. I'd asked for a room with twin beds, and we got them, but pushed together to make a king. The room looked out onto a central atrium, and with no view to the street, it was a little dark. The bathroom was nice with lots of amenities, good towels, and there's a safe in the closet. The TV had no channels in English, except for pay per view movies. The decor is nice and the room has high ceilings with lots of crown moldings. There's a desk and a small table and chair. On the second day, we were able to change rooms for one with a view onto the plaza. This room was slightly larger than the last, with floor-to-ceiling windows and a small balcony. It was quite nice and worth it to change even for one night. All in all, at around 100 euro a night it's a very decent hotel in a great location. Try to get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cannylad1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as a family group for three days on a city break to Madrid. The location is excellent, within walking distance of most major tourist attarctions. The hotel itself is of classical style, clean and comfortable. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. Staff very friendly and accommodating. There are a couple of very pleasant restaurants nearby, including traditional Spanish at very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dotful
Reviews.Content: Having fled a poky and uncomfortable so-called High Tech hotel, we particularly appreciated our night in the Palacio San Martin - which was very good value, even being cheaper than the High Tech horror. Our room was excellent - very large (as large as suites I've stayed in) with huge windows opening on the Plaza, making it beautifully light. The bed was also huge and very comfortable and the bathroom lived up to the rest of the room. Decor generally was fresh, luxurious but not over the top. The service was fine. The hotel is in a very good central location, in easy walking distance of all the main sights, etc, but on a quiet square (I didn't even notice the bells, though the view of the Convent was pleasant). Absolutely no nuisance from vagrants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: janisc
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a very good location. We had no trouble with the vagrants that are mentioned. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, well located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evening
