Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel I've ever stayed in Europe as a single woman where they didnt shove me in the tiniest room with a single bed! Maybe it helped that I told Antonio at the front desk about the not so great room I had in Barcelona (he was about to put me on the 5th floor, where I probably would have had the larger balcony room - but next to the elevator)... The palatial room on the 2nd floor, overlooking the Plaza San Martin with a small balcony was excellent! The bathroom was nice, but definitely should have been arranged differently. I am very agile, but found stepping out of the shower and into the spot between the toilet and bidet a little challenging. As an exhaustive researcher, I had lists of restaurants, and didnt need to ask the desk for recommendations. They were very nice, but a request for a late checkout was met with a firm "no." I was originally booked into the Best Western Carlos V around the corner, and am so glad I changed! The hotels are only a few feet apart, but this streetwise New Yorker didnt get the same safe vibe outside the Best Western that I got at the Palacio San Martin. A lot of street men hanging outside of the Carlos V (the alley the poster mentions in the review just below).

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMarina
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights (thurs, fri). Very Charming. I requested a room on a higher floor in a advance (not sure if that did it) but they gave us a room on the 5th floor with a little terrace looking out onto the side street and the room also had a sitting area. Overall a quite hotel but Thur morning at 7am church bells were ringing. The hotel is newly refurbished (opened 2001) and everything is still seems new and well maintained. The furnishings are very elegant. Buffet Breakfeast is not included, but it is very good and has a large selection if you are willing to spend 16 euro pp. Good thing about it is that you can take sandwiches for lunch and it will last you until dinner time. But there is lots of small coffee shops around the hotel and you can just have coffee and sweet bun for less. Concierge is very polite but helpfull in a limited way. They will explain how to get places but will not suggest a particular restaurant to go to.. just the street where you can find lots of them. The hotel wis alking distance from the center so you don't need to take the subway. The hotel also has a small gym and sauna on the 5th floor if someone is interested.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An ideal location from which to walk to many of Madrid's most interesting sites. The hotel is lovely, quiet, clean, secure and very attractive. The rooftop restaurant provided a fine view of much of the city and good food, although 16 euros per person seemed a bit steep for breakfast. Still, the breakfast was an all-you-can-eat buffet offering many choices, although we only found out from another guest that we could also request eggs cooked to order. We even dined there one evening and had a very good, if somewhat expensive, meal. We had a beautiful room with a very nice, modern bath. Unfortunately, it was on the first floor adjacent to an alley where homeless people and street performers hung out from early morning to late evening, meaning that we had to keep the window and curtains closed at all times. Hotel restaurant staff were great; friendly, charming, efficient. Front desk staff varied from personable and helpful, to "brusque." Some spoke almost no English, although this was not a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vboyd
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Intur Palacio San Martin. It was simply fabulous in every way!!! It's located right in the heart of excellent shopping/dining area. The rooms are exquisite and impecably clean. Our room had two large adjacent walkouts to a gorgeous balcony overlooking the main square. It has all the amenities/services that you'd see in a Luxury 5 star hotel. The stafff were very courteous and helpful. All in all...an excellent find in old Madrid. We hope to be back soon and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, terrible room!”
Reviews.Author: juneyrooney
Reviews.Content: Stayed in intur palacio san martin for three nights. It's a lovely hotel in a great location but we were disappointed with the rooms (or at least one of them). We booked two rooms for three people. Parents had a large sunny room with a little terrazza facing onto the side street. My room, despite being the same price as a double, was small and dark with a view of an interior wall. We also didn't find staff overly helpful. Asked for some recommendations re eating out. We were give the name of one very expensive restaurant and when we asked about others were told by the receptionist that there were loads of restaurants in Madrid and she couldn't recommend any one in particular!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--if you have a good room”
Reviews.Author: hoipolloi
Reviews.Content: Hard to rate this hotel overall, since although the location is excellent, the service was good (though we didn't bother with the breakfast based on other reviews of it being overpriced), and the decoration of the hotel and room were nice in themselves, our room (114) faced onto a wall about two feet away from the window. So there was almost no light let into the room at all and it felt like a dungeon waking up in it in the morning. Because we arrived very late at night we didn't realize this right away, and I wish that we had noticed earlier and complained and gotten into a better room if possible. I got a very good rate on the hotel through the internet but I would have rather paid more and been in a better room. So if you book with this hotel be sure to ask for a room with a view, unless you are a bat and enjoy cave life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steigy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Reasonably priced, richly decorated rooms with beautiful furnishings. Incredibly comfortable bed with a really long pillow. Gorgeous marble bathroom -- typical of a 4* Spanish hotel. More bathroom goodies than you could ever use. (ever forget your toothbrush, comb, tissues, cotton swabs, soap, shampoo, lotion, mouthwash, razor? Don't even bother calling the front desk -- they're already in your room!) The location is great; it's near the Plaza del Sol, but far enough away that you're not caught in that crowded and noisy mess. The Palacio San Martin on a simple and quiet square, next to a historic convent and right down the street from many restaurants, a Cortes Ingles, and great churros y chocolate. The lobby entrance is elegant, and the interior courtyard is a great renovation. The staircase with its historic elevator is classic, and the modern elevators -- well, we never used either since our hotel was on the 1st floor. Only downside -- even though all of the original windows have been doubled in essence with new windows, you can still hear a little bit of noise from outside if you're on the first floor. We'd most certainly say here again the next time we visit Madrid. In fact, we could have on the end of our trip, but chose to stay somewhere else for variety. I wish we had stayed here both times.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ukleder
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the equivalent of a US four star. It is in a good location right in the center of everything yet off the beaten track so it's not so noisy. The rooms are comfortable with air conditioning, french balcony windows overlooking the San Martin Square, and an English speaking TV channel. Toiletries are provided in the bathroom and there is even a bidet. The bathroom is on the small side and it's a bit dangerous getting out of the shower since the toilet & the bidet (which face each other) are right there. So if you're a larger size person, this might not be the best hotel for you. The bed was comfortable with a long pillow, and there is plenty of drawer/closet space along with a safe. The staff is OK but their English isn't great, but that's the way it is in Madrid. If we ever went back to Madrid (which we wouldn't) we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights in the middle of June and were really impressed. The location is superb, just a few minutes walk from the main tourist areas and yet wonderfully quiet day and night. The staff were friendly and helpful and mostly spoke fairly good English. We had a good sized room which was really nice, with massive twin beds and a really good shower in the bathroom and the only downside was that the room was a bit dark and we had no idea what the weather was like outside as the window overlooked the internal courtyard. If I go back to Madrid I'd definetely stay here again but would probably request a room overlooking the main square. Oh, and the air conditioning in the room was brilliant, very important when it's in the high 30's outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wfe and I, A daughter and granddaughter stayed at the Palacio San Martin for a week in early June. We were on a relaxed whirlwind visit (the latest of numerous visits) and found everything we wanted pleasantly available, not intrusive but there. The building is interesting, room very comfortable and clean, location excellent and close to what you want, the french door windows and balconies are especially good if you like french windows. I happen to start enjoying the day hearing the bells of the nearby St. Gimes church, really worth a visit. In short, if you are in Madrid to enjoy a stay, Palacio San Martin is a good place to work from. The young ladies in the front office are especially nice, and Avon Chocolatier around the corner is a good place to start out the day and to finish it. I hope they have rooms available when we visit Spain again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfan054
Reviews.Content: Stayed from May 21-29, 2005. Shared a large corner room (314) with my niece. My parents' room was a little cramped (310). Both were comfortable and had balonies to the plaza. My mother found the bed hard her first night (the rest of us were very comfortable). Based on a review at this site I brought my own pillow, which was unnecessary - there were bolsters on the bed with an extra in the closet. The following were excellent: location; cleanliness; bathroom and shower; friendly and helpful staff; proximity to restaurants, cafes, historical sites, tourist bus, etc; air conditioning. Because of the close-by restaurants, Plaza Mayor, Chocolateria, etc. we cannot comment on the hotel's restaurant. The Plaza de San Martin was quiet, like a neighborhood plaza, and on the one night when it was active, closing the balcony door provided absolute quiet. Being next to the Convent of the Royal Descalceds was a definite advantage, as every taxi driver can identify it as a landmark. For tourists, there are three stops for the hop-on, hop-off bus within a block or two of the hotel. I will stay at this hotel again if I have the opportunity. This hotel compares very favorably to another 4 Star Madrid hotel my parent and I stayed at two years ago. The location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: spookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and were very impressed. Having read the previous reviews I thought it worth my while to ring ahead and ask for an outside-facing room so that the windows would open. The staff, in this as in everything else, were very helpful and accommodating. Our room on the fourth floor was lovely - nice size, well decorated and beautifully clean. We left the balcony doors open at night and it was fairly peaceful - except for the bells in the morning. Loud though they were they added to the charm. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere - to the shops, the main squares etc and the museum district was a pleasant 20-30 minute stroll away. There were fabulous Turkish baths about 10 minutes from the hotel - on the other side of the Plaza del Sol (----), well worth a visit. There were plenty people around the Plaza St Martin at all times and we didn't see anything to concern us so I was happy even when returning to the hotel on my own. The large dept store el corte ingles is 2 minutes away and open til 10pm (I think) so a few times I headed over on my own to do a bit of shopping without having any particular safety worries, in fact the atmosphere in the square was very nice and lively and there were always lots of people walking through. We paid €103 plus I think €7 tax per night for the room with hotels.com. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: DocSaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Apr 21 - 25, 2005, while visiting our son who was studying in Madrid. We had a 2nd floor room facing the plaza...nice open windows and small balcony that allowed for modest "street sounds" when opened, but the room was very quiet with the windows shut. We arrived around 9 AM (after being ripped off by our cab driver) the morning of the 21st after an overnight flight from the states. We were able to immediately check into our room....great bathroom, wonderful shower which was welcome indeed! The staff was helpful, but not everyone spoke very fluent English. Location was outstanding...close to Plaza Mayor, Sol, Palacia Real. The large dept. store, El Corte Ingles was only a block away and we picked up a few snacks and drinks in the downstairs grocery to save some euros. Metro stop at Gran Via and Sol both were very convenient. The Brucke art exhibition across the plaza was free and worth a visit. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, city centre location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Top notch location, good service, good food, clean room, would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean, organized hotel. We stayed in a junior suite, with a beautiful terrace. Not much to see from it, but nice to wake-up to sunshine and to get a chance to see what the weather would be for that day. The main highlight of this hotel is the central location. Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Banco de Espagna, all of these places were a short walking distance from San Martin. And if you dont feel like walking, so many metro stops to choose from. The staff was also very friendly, and spoke English very well. If I return to Madrid, I would definitly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine choice for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MaryFranSpokane
Reviews.Content: What a great value this hotel is. Staff was helpful and friendly, and our room was lovely. Great location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Value, Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Ajjar
Reviews.Content: First, thanks to many posts here I am pleased to have chosen and just stayed at the San Martin. The hotel is stylish, very clean, well decorated and very interesting. All staff were very helpful, friendly and accomodating. Recommendations, reservations and suggestions were well made. The room was a good size for a European hotel with many amenities, especially for one in this price range. The location is excellent, in the overlapping area of Old Madrid and Downtown Madrid. We walked almost everywhere, with an occasional metro ride (one block away). The hotel is footsteps from the major department store, El Cortes Ingles. Scores of stores surround it, running parallel to the hotel. Small cafes, tapas bars, great discos, restaurants are within a few blocks. The hotel was very quiet, as there were no late bars in the immediate area. Our room faced the inside enclosed atrium courtyard which was fine by us. Some opinions here have referenced vagabonds in the area. We saw a few, they were all throughout Madrid as in most major cities. There were a few who did like to hang out near the hotel, but they were unobtrusive, polite and never threatening. The hotel is next to a church and art museum, facing a plaza and is not secluded. We were late partyers, walking around the area at 2 a.m., without concern. I am a frequent traveler to 4 and 5 star hotels in the US and Europe. I was looking for a 3-4* hotel in Madrid (this is officially a 4*) and I was well satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonrockville
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near Plaza del Sol. Did not see the vagrants that some other reviews mentioned although there were teenagers hanging around the plaza on a few occasions. Neither did we hear any church bells, perhaps because our room did not face the plaza. Our room was quite spacious by European standards. Nice bathroom with tub/shower. Front desk staff was very helpful. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment. There are numerous bakeries, Starbucks, etc. nearby to get coffee and a roll for breakfast. Overall, an excellent hotel and good value.

Reviews.Title: “fab choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 2004 A very pleasant surprise we had at this hotel, we booked a room facing the plaza after reading a tripadvisor review and were not disappointed. The location is a dream, close to everything without the noise. It's a wonderful place to stay. Rooms are reasonably priced, a good size, well decorated, very clean and extremely comfortable. The square was pretty quiet and yes there were a few people hanging out on the corner sometimes asking for money, but they were not aggressive or intimidating. We will definately stay again, and for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with some bad neighbors”
Reviews.Author: karmamama
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in two rooms next to each other at the Intur Palacio San Martin. Both rooms had nice bathrooms, good beds (we all slept wonderfully and loved the pillows), little French balconies overlooking grubby square. We were bothered, however, by obnoxious and violent bums who hung out in the plaza in front of the hotel. Their constant presence really detracted from the decent quality of the hotel and its helpful staff. Somehow, the hotel managers need to realize that a place is more than just the some of its parts. While I liked the hotel, I wouldn't want my family to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is Everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is everything on vacation and the Intur Palacio was perfect. We found the hotel charming and authentically Spanish. It's not the easiest place to find (don't even bother trying if you're driving yourself) but it's tucked nicely away within walking distance of practically everything. The rooms were clean, neat, air-conditioned and very European (in a good way). My wife and I don't like staying in hotels that don't feel like we've left the States so we really liked this place. The building was once an Embassy. They had a great breakfast buffet on the top floor and the front desk people were very helpful (although make sure you speak Spanish or have a guide book because there are usually only one or two people on duty at a time and there's no guarantee they will speak English). All in all, we were very happy with the hotel. It's not a Ritz Carlton but it's perfect if you're looking for someplace nice and authentic that is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Ind327
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcome stop after nearly 5 weeks in Spain. At the beginning of August, we had a double room with a balcony that opened onto the plaza below. The room was not small (though not extremely large), the bed was large and the place was very clean and modern. We enjoyed it thoroughly and would definitely stay there again. By the way, we heard no church bells either- could be that we were sound asleep after enjoying Madrid till all hours of the night (as the Madrilenos do). In addition, if you happen to be there when everyone leaves Madrid for holiday, the room rates are far below what they normally are.... a great value overall!

HotelInfo.Name: Intur Palacio San Martin
HotelInfo.Address: Plaza San Martin, 5, 28013 Madrid, Spain
